title: Senior Accountant
description:
We Need A Detail-Minded Senior Accountant Like You! 
You will be working with a professional, self-initiative and independent team in an Asia-based integrated marketing company! 
As our Senior Accountant, reports to the CEO, South Asia, you will be responsible for managing full accounting and financial operation of the regional/local offices in the South Asia Region, preparing, developing and analyzing key financial information of South Asia to ensure that company’s management makes well-informed decisions to ensure future stability, growth and profitability. Also, you have to establish and maintain accounting policy and management information systems, as well as provide a high quality support service by liaising with management colleagues on all aspects of accounting and analyzing the performance of a business and advice on how to pre-empt problems, adapt to changing circumstances and improve value. Moreover, help in any ad hoc and challenging tasks are needed. 
Your education is important. Your experience is important. But they are not as important as your talent. 
Requirements:

Minimum 12 years’ relevant experience with min 3 years of supervisory experience in managing a team
Certified Accountant
Experience in Management Accounting is highly desirable
Working knowledge/exposure in NAV system
Detail-mind with strong analytical ability 
Ability to establish a clear, feasible, and measurable plan, schedule or work priorities under limited supervision 
Proven ability to lead a team effectively
Experience in dealing with multiple reports channels and managing various remote offices would be an advantage 
Comfortable in matrix reporting structure in the organization
Knowledge in statutory coporate tax and regulatory compliance is a must 

 Check out our corporate site to know more on what we do:
Group Site:   |   SG Site:  
We are currently seeking the best eligible candidates to join our team. Tell us how you fit in by applying and sending in your resume.
Those who had previously applied need not reapply. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.                                jobsDB will send your application for review directly to                                Milton Exhibits Singapore Pte Ltd                  Career Level               Senior level                Yr(s) of Exp               12 years experience                Qualification             Degree              Company Industry      Job Function   >  >  >     Salary negotiable             Salary negotiable                           Employment Type           Full Time, Permanent            Benefits  Five-day work weekPerformance bonus                    About                     Milton Exhibits Singapore Pte Ltd               Do you want to work in a vibrant, creative and innovative environment?

title: Senior Executive, Internal Audit
description:
Responsibilities


Executing risk based financial, operational and compliance audit which includes developing internal audit scope, audit planning and performing internal audit procedures.


Identify and communicate to stakeholders on business inefficiencies, internal control weaknesses or operational issues observed during audits and recommend appropriate solutions.


Preparing internal audit reports highlighting control gaps and non-compliance with the Group’s policies and procedures.


Assisting in developing of annual risk-based audit plan and periodic reporting to the Audit Committee.


Performing follow-up reviews on previous internal audit issues to ensure actions are taken to address identified internal audit issues. 


To assist management with ad-hoc projects, as and when required.


 
Requirements:


A good Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy or Finance.


Professional certifications (e.g. CPA, ACCA, CIA) is preferred.


A minimum of 3 years of experience in internal, external audit and/or business process reviews.


Strong command of MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) is essential.


Independent, resourceful, good inter-personal skill and a team player.


Demonstrating working to a high level with minimal supervision.


Strong English and Chinese proficiency (written and oral), is a must in a view of the need to liaise with the Group’s business entities in China and other countries.


Able to travel extensively




Interested candidates are invited to submit resume (in MS Word format) to us.

Your present and expected salary
Notice period required
Your earliest date of availability, and
A recent photograph

description:

Trade derivatives and forward/future contracts to secure company’s profit margin, comply with the company’s risk policy and procedures.

title: Credit Controller - South East Asia market (Tagalog Speaker)
description:
A Credit Controller is responsible for the oversight of a portfolio of accounts. The Credit Controller is the main point of contact for these customers for all invoice related issues.  The Credit Controller is expected to build strong relationships with customers and business partners in an effort to insure all invoices are paid to the terms of the Booking.com contract.  Due to the rapid and continuous growth of the organization, the tasks and duties of this role may evolve over time. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and to take on additional challenges and responsibilities as they occur.
B.responsible

Collect Open Invoices from Accommodation Partners in the Philippines
Provides scalable solutions which can be implemented to streamline processes
Cross functional Communication with both internal and external parties
Increase growth of company through improving cycle times like DSO, Cash allocation and Delivery of invoices

Thanks to these works, the Credit Controller will acquire an in-depth knowledge of Booking’s business and internal organization and will prepare him/her -self to a broader role.
Key factors of success in this role are a good understanding of the business priorities, strong communication skills and, above all, the capacity to implement projects and reach the pre-set objectives.
B.skilled

Drive progress through simple and targeted action plans. Implement short term loops of progress and tackle the issues one by one at a high pace
Create Best Practice and share with Peers
Be a business partner with Hotels team
Create a out of the box mind set to improve customer payment behavior
Is owner of Key Performance Indicators  like DSO, % received cash, within 30 days, 60 days and 90 days.
Ensure adherence to Company policies and applicable governmental regulations.
Liaise with peers across the business to create successful roll outs

Planning skills

Managing and Developing Yourself
Technical knowledge of Collections software
Strategic/Longer Term Contribution
Ability to travel if required as part of the role

Skills & competencies:

Ability to proactively drive the assigned projects and reach the preset objectives.
Excellent communication and transversal management skills.
Ability to recognize financial implications of business decisions and strategy.
Understanding of business practices and systems.
Facilitate and practice security and confidentiality of information
Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills
English and Tagalog verbal and written communication skills. 
Preferably 1-3 years’ experience in Finance or related field
You currently reside in Singapore

title: Credit Controller - Japan market
description:
Booking.com (S) Pte Ltd | jobsDB Singapore

    































 
☰ Menu
        







Change Country










































































             Join planet Earth's #1 accommodation siteBooking.com was established in 1996 in Amsterdam, The Netherlands and has grown into the world’s leading online hotel and accommodation reservations company. Booking.com is still operated from Amsterdam and supported by 199 offices.15,000 people right across the world are dedicated to serving Booking.com’s customers and property-owning partners.We want to be the best team of motivated and skilled people in the industry. Over 142 nationalities are employed at Booking.com. We are a melting pot of people from all over the world working together. Employees are encouraged to develop their own talents. We have a variety of trainings and other methods within our Booking.com University program to help to do just that.Our Account Management and Content teams work with our property partners to support transparency, availability, and best pricing for all our customers. Our multilingual Customer Service team provides 24/7 dedicated assistance and advocacy to make sure our customers’ stays meet or exceed their expectations. Our IT teams in Amsterdam take care of creating a perfect shopping experience for our customers.Our missionTo help leisure and business travellers, whatever their budgets, easily discover, book, and enjoy the world’s best places to stay.We are part of the Priceline Group (NASDAQ: PCLN).    Credit Controller - Japan market     07-Jun-17  jobsDB Ref. JSG400003003237302         Tools                 Booking.com Customer Service Center (Singapore) Pte Ltd, one of the support companies in Singapore, is looking for a full-time Credit Controller based in our Singapore Office.
A Booking.com Credit Controller is responsible for the oversight of a portfolio of accounts. The Credit Controller is the main point of contact for these customers for all invoice related issues. The Credit Controller is expected to build strong relationships with customers and business partners in an effort to insure all invoices are paid to the terms of the Booking.com contract. Due to the rapid and continuous growth of the organization, the tasks and duties of this role may evolve over time. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and to take on additional challenges and responsibilities as they occur.
B.responsible

Collect Open Invoices from Accommodation Partners in the assigned region
Provides scalable solutions which can be implemented to streamline processes
Cross functional Communication with both internal and external parties
Increase growth of company through improving cycle times like DSO, Cash allocation and Delivery of invoices

Thanks to these works, the Credit Controller will acquire an in-depth knowledge of Booking’s business and internal organization and will prepare him/her -self to a broader role.
Key factors of success in this role are a good understanding of the business priorities, strong communication skills and, above all, the capacity to implement projects and reach the pre-set objectives.
B.skilled

Drive progress through simple and targeted action plans. Implement short term loops of progress and tackle the issues one by one at a high pace
Create Best Practice and share with Peers
Be a business partner with Hotels team
Create a out of the box mind set to improve customer payment behavior
Is owner of Key Performance Indicators like DSO, % received cash, within 30 days, 60 days and 90 days.
Ensure adherence to Company policies and applicable governmental regulations.
Liaise with peers across the business to create successful roll outs

Planning skills

Managing and Developing Yourself
Technical knowledge of Collections software
Strategic/Longer Term Contribution
Ability to travel if required as part of the role

Skills & competencies:

Ability to proactively drive the assigned projects and reach the preset objectives.
Excellent communication and transversal management skills.
Ability to recognize financial implications of business decisions and strategy.
Understanding of business practices and systems.
Facilitate and practice security and confidentiality of information
Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills
English and Japanese verbal and written communication skills.
Preferably 2 years’ experience in Finance or related field
Candidates already reside in Singapore

title: REGIONAL FINANCIAL CONTROLLER
description:
Position Overview
We are looking for a Regional Financial Controller in BBDO Asia Pacific, based in Singapore, to manage the financial and business operations of the Group including treasury, audit and risk management.   You should be a highly motivated self-starter and versatile team player who is equipped with strong US GAAP knowledge, possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills and has strong business acumen. 
 
Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Track and review the business financial performance, monthly re-forecasts and business planning of the Group. As part of the process, to alert the business leaders and initiate remedial and corrective actions where needed. 
Consolidate, analyze, interpret and prepare financial reports from the region for Head Office and management review, discussion and decisions. 
Lead the region’s finance team in implementation of global accounting policies, in accordance with US GAAP, and processes to ensure compliance with corporate standards.
Provide regional risk, compliance and control guidance around SOX and compliance activities, remediation plan and reporting and coordinate and perform audit activities across the region.
Drive continuous improvement and efficiencies to financial reporting, forecasting and business improvement processes.
Provide business information to management, business leaders and clients by collating and summarizing data, preparing reports and making presentations of findings, analyses and recommendations.
Business partner senior management in making strategic business decisions.
Provide guidance and support to local markets in resolving any local market tax and audit issues.
Participate in scenario analysis and support commercial business negotiations.
Review and manage client contracts to ensure compliance with group policies. 
Undertake ad-hoc projects.

 
Requirements

A qualified Chartered Accountant with degree in accountancy from a recognized university
At least 7 years of professional experience in reputable accounting firm with US GAAP knowledge
Strong technical accounting knowledge with ability to articulate appropriate accounting treatment
Hands-on person with strong ability to work under pressure and balance multiple demands and competing priorities 
Good problem solver with strong business acumen, interpersonal and communication skills
Highly organized, analytical and detail oriented
Willing to travel within the region (at least once quarterly)

title: VP, Senior Journey & Transformation Manager, Risk Management Group
description:
Business Function    Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank’s risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure.     Responsibilities Responsible for leading change projects in partnership with RMG units using design-thinking and lean six sigma improvement methodologies. Liaise with senior management and/or other stakeholders to drive outcomes. Conduct training and workshops. Provide hands-on support for transformational journeys within RMG across markets. Identify and resolve issues and conflicts, escalate issues as needed, and provide regular progress updates to senior management. Understand & map processes to drive digitalisation using RPA, Machine Intelligence in collaboration with all RMG teams.  Requirements Master’s / University degree in Business, Information Technology or related discipline. Over 10 years of experience in project management, business analysis, IT consulting and transformation in Financial Services. Strong project management experience. Understanding of Design Thinking and Agile. Excellent communication (oral and written) including presentation skills. Understanding of various IT systems & processes within Risk Management.   Lean Six Sigma certification / training will be a plus. Strong interpersonal skills with experience in managing multiple stakeholders. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.     Apply Now   We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.               Career Level               Middle level                Yr(s) of Exp               10 years experience                Qualification             Degree              Company Industry      Job Function   >     Salary negotiable             Salary negotiable                           Employment Type           Full Time                            About                     DBS Bank Ltd                        DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015.              Website

title: Finance Operations Manager (Lion City Rentals) - Singapore
description:
About the Role
We are looking for a dynamic, engaged individual to fill the role of Finance Operations Manager for our vehicle solutions business (https://www.lioncityrentals.com.sg/).
 
This role requires a people leader who loves to build, maintain, and enhance processes, where you'll be leveraging on your leadership, knowledge, and stakeholder management skills to ensure that functions in the backend run like clockwork. 
What you'll do

Build up controls that tightens up the back end finance functions in the organisation, while ensuring that the business is enabled to expand
Empathetic and motivational to keep your team of 10-15 people engaged with the business - their success is your success
Stakeholder management with strategic finance, accounting, payments, and treasury teams
Management and mentoring of the existing billing/admin team
Manage the operational analysis of ongoing business operations and key performance indicators
Monitoring compliance with external and internal regulations and policies
Manage process and system changes resulting from the broader organisation

What you'll need

An undergraduate degree with strong strong academic results and an analytical mind
At least 6 years experience in a Finance/Banking Operations role, focusing on payments, billings, reconciliation and risk
Obsessed over any details that goes wrong or might go wrong, with determination to make sure that it does not happen again
Grit. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on, you persevere when others fall away
True passion for LCR’s mission and the company’s hybrid technology / operations nature
A raw excitement to scale a business and learn

Bonus points if

Understand the vehicle solutions business which you will be providing expertise for

 
Perks 

Employees are given Uber rides every month.
The rare opportunity to change the way the world moves. We're not just another social web app, we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally.
Smart, engaged co-workers.

 
Benefits


Full medical + dental package to fit your needs.


Unlimited vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it.

Phone + Gym membership allowances

 
  
Uber is an equal opportunity employer and enthusiastically encourages people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences to apply. Uber does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, age, mental or physical disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Asset Wealth Manager
description:
An Asset Wealth Manager helps individuals build and preserve their financial wealth by creating and implementing long-term asset allocation within the context of each client’s particular risk tolerance, providing access to innovating investment ideas and opportunities, developing customized investment strategies, and offering a full array of wealth management services, including private banking, trust, and estate services. 
 
Handling a portfolio of a selected niche base, your key responsibility will be to develop and implement financial plans for these individuals and corporations. In consultation with clients, you will determine their assets, liabilities, cash flow, insurance coverage, tax status, and financial objectives, and be required to analyse clients' financial status in order to develop financial plans. Acting as the main liaison between the company and the client, you will be in continuous contact with clients to revise their plans based on changes in the needs of clients or the investment market. 
 
Along with a Polytechnic Diploma or higher, it is recommended to have one to two years of sales experience working in financial institutions. To succeed in this role, you will need to have a high degree of self-motivation and be extremely results-oriented. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are necessary. Individuals from other industries with a proven sales track record are also welcome to apply.
 
                   Industry      Job Function   >  >  >     Zonal Segregation      Salary  S$4,000 - 6,000 /month (includes high commission)     Employment Type Full Time, Permanent   Benefits  Double payFlexible working hoursMedical insurancePerformance bonus

title: Japanese Speaking; Business Promotions Planning Executive / Specialist - Corporate Bank
description:
Our client is one of the leading foreign Corporate Banks in Singapore.With the expansion of the bank, they are currently looking for talented candidate to join their team.
 
 
 
Japanese Speaking; Business Promotions Planning Executive / Specialist - Corporate Bank

 
(Japanese Speaking = to handle Japanese documents as well as communications with HQ in Japan)
 
 
 
Job Overview:

The department is responsible for setting up a business strategy and a business plan for the Asia & Oceania region, which includes the conduct of profit management and administrative operations for the branches, subsidiaries and affiliates under the International Banking Unit in the Asia & Oceania region (“the Branches”).
 
In addition, the incumbent shall oversee the legal regulations and compliance matters of the Branches and ensure that the bank comply with the local regulator of each country that they operate in.
 
Above all, they promote collaboration with subsidiaries or affiliated companies of The Financial Group.

 
 
Job Responsibilities:
 
Supporting the team to promote their business regionally through various channels including but not limited to coordinating and managing enquiries and activities to facilitate business promotion meetings and activities.
Advising the corporate bankers and relationship managers in their regional branches on business opportunities through close relationships with them.
Conducting analysis and studies to develop business plans and preparing presentation materials .
 
 
Job Requirements:
 
A Bachelor’s degree with at least three years prior relevant experience working in a Bank
Experience working in a Bank with corporate banking and/or accounting background will be an advantage but not mandatory.
Business-level proficiency in both English and Japanese languages, as the incumbent is expected to read and understand documents as well as respond in these two languages 
 
 


Should you be interested, kindly forward a detailed copy of your resume in MSWord to    
 
Please DO NOT use Quick Apply 
 
 
Please include the following details in your resume:
(1) Personal details such as full name as in NRIC, NRIC, nationality, contact address, numbers, email 
(2) Reasons for leaving your current and previous employment(s)
(3) Current / last drawn and expected salaries
(4) Availability / Notice Period required
(5) At least 2 names and contact numbers of relevant reference persons relating to your previous employment/s.
 
We thank you in advance for your application and will get in touch with you as soon as possible should you be short-listed.

We listen to your specific recruitment needs from the time your call is picked up, and we make recruitment a hassle-free process for employers.

title: Corporate Finance Manager
description:
POSITION SUMMARYReporting to the Head, Corporate Finance & Development, you will play an integral role to assist him to drive the Industrial Group’s financial and business strategy development initiatives. You will be responsible for assisting in the evaluation, due diligence, execution and monitoring of strategic investments, transactions & deals, preparing financial analysis and business reports, project management and partnering with the business units in evaluating business development opportunities from financial perspective to drive business results and profitability. JOB RESPONSIBILITIESConduct market research and prepare industry reports such as on market trends and statistics, regulatory environment and competitor/terrain analysisAnalyse investment and business opportunities including detailed analyses of business drivers, financial modelling, valuation, investment/ business proposalsIdentify and recommend potential business opportunities (e.g. prospective mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures) to develop and grow the Group businessPerform feasibility studies, prepare financial business modelling for the new market initiatives, computing the returns on the investments.Perform due diligence to provide a thorough understanding and analysis of the financials needed to evaluate the business opportunities.Liaise with all parties involved in transactions and assist with negotiationsInvolved in mergers and acquisitions and other Business Development / Finance development workIndependently manage projects including pitches as well as engagementsPrepare analysis and presentations for senior management to inform decision making and support the execution of significant transactions.Partner business units in evaluating key business development opportunities from a financial perspectiveManage investments and projects based on timelines and resources to maximise returnsSupport routine and ad-hoc business & financial analysis and reportingJOB REQUIREMENTSDegree in Accountancy or Finance is preferredAt least 5 years of corporate finance, transactions advisory or consulting experience. Investment Banking profiles are welcomedProven experience in corporate finance, strategy planning across industries / geographiesStrategic thinking, business acumen with strong research and analytical capabilities to synthesize and interpret data to form insightsAbility to build and run financial models independently and analyse finance, investment risk and business reportsExcellent project management and problem solving skillsGood presentation skills and ability to simplify and communicate complex business finance to stakeholdersAble to influence and communicate effectively across different levels We offer competitive remuneration and career progression to applicants with the relevant industry or role experience. Please write in with your updated resume stating your current & expected salary, reason for pursuing and earliest available date once clicking on the APPLY button Please indicate the Position Title applied for clearly in your Subject Line or quote Job Reference if available. Please note that your personal data disclosed to IMC Pan Asia Alliance Pte Ltd, IMC Industrial Pte Ltd and their group of companies, shall be used for the purposes of evaluation, and processing in accordance with our recruitment processes and policies. By providing your personal data, you have consented to the aforesaid purpose under the provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

 COMPANY PHOTOS


























 


 COMPANY OVERVIEW



		The IMC Group is a privately-held enterprise based in Asia. Its roots can be traced back to the early 1900s, when the founder’s family was engaged in the provision of transportation and banking services. Currently headquartered in Singapore, the IMC Group has more than 10,500 employees and contractors with major presence in China, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and Australia.

		 

		IMC Industrial Group is part of IMC Group, a privately-owned enterprise based in Asia. With a maritime heritage dating back to early 1900s, the company has transformed from a traditional shipping company into a diversified group with a strong focus on integrated industrial supply chains. IMC Industrial Group seeks to connect the world’s major resource producers to Asia’s industrial end-users through integrated marine and logistics solutions, linking them with supply chains incorporating inland transportation, offshore transshipment, ocean shipping, ports, terminals and shipyards, stockpiling, blending and storage as well as local distribution.


	 



 


 WHY JOIN US?



Strong Fundamentals
		The IMC Group is founded on strong fundamentals augmented by an experienced management team and proven track records. You can be assured of joining a fundamentally strong company.

		 

Environment for Growth
		The IMC Group firmly commits to the development of global leaders who are aware, able and willing to adapt to the fast-changing terrain of the 21st Century. Our collaborative working culture helps to build communities for learning and growth in a supportive environment.

		 

Professional & Organisational Development
		Our global footprint provides a great platform for our people to connect with different offices around the globe. These learning opportunities provide deep insight into various functions as well as the culture of a forward looking organization.

		 

Rewards & Recognition
		At IMC, we believe in rewarding our employees fairly based on their performance and contribution to the success of the organization. We provide competitive salaries and benefits benchmarked to the market.

		 
Diversity
	IMC Group engages in diverse businesses and a wide range of industries and our commitment is to contribute to the fulfillment of the needs of society. What differentiates us is the way we dance together in harmony not in spite of but because of our diverse IMC communities. Our people hail from varied backgrounds and cultures. The ability to recognize, explore and embrace our individual differences in a safe, positive and nurturing environment is fundamental to our success.

In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015). More information about Capita Staffing & Search is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp.

Responsible for translating and coding contractual terms to the billing system environment and cash collections on multiple revenue streams while ensuring compliance with corporate billing, collection and credit policies.

Responsible for translating and coding contractual terms to the Billing System environment.

Support audit matters and liaise with internal and external auditors where required.
Perform any other tasks when assigned.

title: Manager, Tax
description:
With more than 80 years of successful operations, AIA Singapore is a leading life insurer with one of the largest agency force and dedicated staff locally.  Our commitment to protecting Singapore’s health and financial future has helped us win numerous accolades including the Singapore Health Award 2014 by the Health Promotion Board as well as Human Resources magazine’s No.1 Employee Insurance Vendor of the Year for nine consecutive years and No.1 Employee Healthcare Provider of the Year for two consecutive years.  AIA Singapore is committed to enrich the lives of both our customers and people. Our dedication to providing our people with a supportive environment that allows them to achieve their career goals has helped us garner HR Asia Magazine’s Best Companies to Work for in Asia 2014 & 2015 Award. This is where your capabilities will be stretched and you’ll be empowered to deliver your best. To find out how you can boost your career, visit our website at  now.    Manager, Tax   This position is responsible for assisting the Tax Lead on internal reporting, statutory tax reporting, governance and controls, process improvement for tax areas and tax advisory with the main focus on Corporate Income Taxes. Practical knowledge of life insurance tax computations is a plus.  This person is expected to work independently and be meticulous in their work.  This person should also possess good communication skills.  Key Responsibilities    Tax reporting based on local tax filing requirements for Corporate Income Tax, GST and Withholding Tax, if any. Improve governance and controls, process improvement for Direct Taxes which requires working together with other sections and departments for such improvements. Ensure tax compliance with local tax rules and regulations. Keep abreast of changes in tax regulations and recommend any tax initiatives for the Company. Handle any tax queries from tax regulators. Support Reporting Team on accounting of Direct Taxes. Participate in projects and initiatives of the Company.  Key Requirements   Degree holder or professional qualification. At least 7 years of experience, preferably in insurance industry or tax consulting firms managing clients from insurance industry. Relevant tax accreditation. Focus on Corporate Income Taxes but knowledge of GST is also required.  Interested applicants, please submit your application online via our careers page.                  Career Level               Middle level                Yr(s) of Exp               7 years experience                Qualification             Degree              Company Industry      Job Function   >     Salary negotiable             Salary negotiable                           Employment Type           Full Time                            About                     AIA Singapore                        AIA is one of the pre-eminent and the largest listed life insurance groups in the world with an exclusive focus on the Asia Pacific region. This size, leadership position and regional presence across 18 geographical markets can offer you greater exposure to new experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a clear vision and throughout the company’s 90 years of history, we continue to change and transform for the future and for the better. In addition to playing an important role in supporting and preserving the economies of markets where we operate, the very nature of the insurance industry is all about providing protection to people when they need it particularly during difficult times. The people at AIA are all committed to working together with this common moral purpose and take great pride from what they do. If these propositions appeal to you and if you are proactive, forward-looking and innovative, consider a career at AIA.

title: FP&A Manager - Heavy Industry
description:
Our client is a Globaly-recognised industrial company with a reputation for quality products. They are looking for a new FP&A Manager to help drive sales growth, in the SE Asia region. This role will have a high level of visibility in the Singapore office, and work extensively with Business Units in the SE Asia region.  Reporting to the Financial Director, the FP&A Manager will be primarily responsible for performing the budgeting, forecasting and analysis of all financial activities across the SE Asia region. You will be leading a small team of Analysts, and providing support to multiple business units. You are expected to establish a Regional COE (Centre of Excellence) for business decision support.  Your team will analyse a number of balance sheet and P&L related items, including country sales and production figures, operational and capital expenditures, as well as other operational KPIs and ad hoc market intelligence, to support investment decisions.  The successful candidate will be Bachelor’s Degree qualified, with over 5 years’ experience in financial analysis roles, in heavy industrial sectors. Candidates with exposure to Oracle or SAP will have a distinct advantage. To be successful in this role, you will need to be hands on with regards to report generation and data analysis (Excel VB skills), very detailed and with the ability to translate raw data into meaningful information supporting decision making.  Strong communication and presentation skills are also required to enable you to present your findings in an influential manner, to senior stakeholders and business unit managers.  To apply, please submit your resume to Huwy Jones at hj @kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number HJ 11996. We regret that only successfully shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Contract Staff (Senior), Credit Analyst, Financial Institutions, Institutional Banking Group - 170000J1
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015.
 
DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Business Function
 
Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards.
 
Responsibilities 
* Credit Analyst for Financial Institutions covering banks, securities brokers, insurers, funds  and asset managers. 
* Perform counterparty risk assessment , review accounts, recommend internal risk ratings and limits for new/existing  financial institution counterparties. 
* Work closely with Relationship Managers (includes client visits) to understand needs of financial institution counterparties. Involve in making  sound and well-reasoned credit recommendations by balancing risk and business needs. 
* Perform other credit monitoring and reporting responsibilities, such as monitoring triggers and covenants, and performing stress tests etc.
* Response efficiently and appropriately to ad-hoc credit requests. 
* Ensure compliance of internal and regulatory policies. 
* Work with different stakeholders to facilitate documentation negotiation (such as ISDA/CSA/GMRA) 
 
Requirements   
* Bachelors Degree with at least 1-3 years' relevant experience; Good knowledge of Treasury products is essential. 
* A team player with good interpersonal relationship skills. 
* Good analysis and writing skills. 
* Prior experience in covering Financial Institutions is a plus.
* Experience in documentation negotiation (e.g. ISDA/CSA/GMRA) is a plus.
 
Apply Now 
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements. 


 |        | 






 About This Company 

DBS Bank Limited
Banking / Finance / Insurance / Investment / Securities        




DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015. DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking activities across Asia. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. These market insights and regional connectivity have helped to drive the bank’s growth as it sets out to be the Asian bank of choice. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia. With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of our 21,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities. For more information, please visit .

title: Tax Associate - Investment Firm
description:
Your new company My client is a leading investment firm known globally. They have been known to make investments within the financial services, healthcare and telecommunications sector. They are currently worth in the billions and have had a stable portfolio for many years.  Your new role This is a regional role with coverage across Europe, Asia and US. The role is heavy on the compliance side however would have ad hoc advisory exposure moving forward. The role has a process improvements element to it whereby tax automation will be a key part. You will need to monitor legislation's across countries where the investments sit and also have a good understanding of tax incentives. This role would also include direct/indirect tax and also transfer pricing components.  What you'll need to succeed You will need to have at least 4 years of experience within the tax space. Those with a strong mix of cross border transaction (M&A tax or Transaction Tax) experience and tax compliance would be highly advantageous. You will need to have strong communication skills and have had experience with implementing process improvements.  What you'll get in return You will be remunerated very well with strong bonus structure. You will be within a global team and this will be a good stepping stone to your next career progression.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. title: Assistant Tax Manager - Leading Asset Management
description:
Your new company My client is a premier asset management company with strong ties in the UK. They are widely known and highly regarded. This role would report into the Head of Tax for APAC and have regional coverage.  Your new role The responsibilities include tax compliance (70%) and tax advisory (30%). The role will cover most of the APAC region, which includes Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, China and Japan. The job has also facets of transfer pricing and both direct/indirect tax. Your main responsibility is to monitor tax legislation's around the APAC region and provide insight to tax structures/planning for the group.  What you'll need to succeed You will need to have at least 6 years of tax experience with a combination of Big 4 and commercial with FSI incentive background. You will need to possess strong stakeholder management skills, as you will be the second in charge for tax in the region. You will be expected to be hands on, proactive and have an eager to learn attitude.  What you'll get in return You will be remunerated well and will be provided with strong training from the Head of Tax. title: Senior Internal Auditor – Global Healthcare Leader
description:
An established industry leader in the Healthcare space with a strong global presence, our client is looking for a dynamic Senior Internal Auditor to join their APAC audit team based in Singapore and add value to the business. Reporting to the Internal Audit Director, the Senior Internal Auditor will be working in a high-functioning team with responsibilities for planning and executing financial and operational audits across the globe with the opportunity to coordinate with the Global HQ. This will entail audits of manufacturing sites, sales and commercial offices as well as distribution centers, where you will be making appropriate recommendations to management. You will work closely with the business, reviewing internal controls and establishing best practices across the regional offices. You will also have ad-hoc responsibilities for special projects such as fraud investigations and compliance work. Global travel of up to 60% is anticipated for this position. This will be a great opportunity for candidates who want to pursue a career in the Healthcare industry as the function provides a stepping stone for career development in the organization. The successful candidate should have a relevant finance degree with 3 - 5 years of experience, preferably from a Big 4 audit firm. Prior exposure with healthcare audits and knowledge of the pharmaceuticals space will be highly valued. Aside from being communicative, detailed and a strong team player, the candidate must have a track record in project management, negotiation and relationship management. Bilingual candidates will be highly valued due to the international remit of the role. To apply, please submit your resume to Timothy Ho at th @kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number TH11668. Only successfully shortlisted candidates will be notified. description:

US Manufacturing MNC / Fortune 500
Fast Moving Consumer Goods business (FMCG)

title: Finance Manager (SAP/ Central/ Up to $7K)
description:
[Order Number: 1704-47465]
 
 
Responsibilities


Accountable for applying principles of accounting to analyze financial information and prepare financial reports by compiling information, preparing all type of financial statements, and utilizing appropriate accounting control procedures.
Monitor the financial performance of the companies are in accordance to the budgets/forecast.  
Assess, report and ensure effective controls over financial and business risks.
Analyze variances and recommend appropriate actions where necessary
Addresses large number of accounting behaviors including universal ledger groundwork, financial treatment and the support of financial plan and activities.
Daily monitoring of the cash position and preparation of cash forecasts on weekly basis
Close liaison with bankers on daily fluctuations of foreign currencies exposures and transact forward bookings to minimize/maximize exchange loss/gain
Supervise, train and develop key competencies of accounting personnel.

ACCA or Degree in Accounting / Finance with CPA/ CA.
At least 5 years of experience in Accounts/ Finance including full sets of Accounts
3 to 5 years of professional accounting experience in Big Four is preferred.
Knowledge of finance, full sets of accounting, budgeting/forecast,Singapore Income Tax and internal control principles.
Familiar with Singapore Financial Reporting Standards, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and International Fiancial Reporting Standards
Knowledge and skill in supervisory practices and principles.
Knowledge of SAP/BPC software applications.
Ability to analyze financial data and prepare financial reports, statements and projections.
Skilled in performing detailed and complex numerical computations and reports.
Prior experience in preparing financial forecasts consolidated accounts and credit management is preferred.
A good team player who is also pro-active, meticulous and able to work under tight deadlines.
Willing to travel  (10%)

description:
Our client is a significant regional player in the healthcare industry and is headquartered in Singapore. As a result of strong regional growth and evolving business needs, there is a need for a Finance Manager to join the team and support the business. Reporting to the Financial Controller, the Finance Manager will be responsible for financial analysis, budgeting, profitability analysis and management reporting for the purposes of providing finance decision support for the business, specifically for key business units across countries. title: Technology Advisory Manager
description:
The Technology Advisory/Information Security Manager provides advisory and technical support to help our clients improve the Information Risk and Security Management function to respond to the increasing cyber security threat. You will do this by providing information security subject matter expertise and utilising your business insight to work collaboratively with our clients to design build and implement pragmatic security solutions.  You will also lead an in-house IT team in providing end-user support services.
The key responsibilities are as follows:

Manage a team of security consultants and ensure high quality of deliverables to clients
Offers management consultancy advice and practical assistance on information security risk and control matters throughout the organisation
Perform application and infrastructure penetration tests, as well as physical security review and social engineering tests for clients
Review and define requirements for information security solutions
Perform security reviews of application designs, source code and deployments as required, covering all types of applications (web application, web services, mobile applications, thick client applications, SaaS)
Conducts information security risk assessments and control selection activities
Work on improvements for provided security services, including the continuous enhancement of existing methodology material and supporting assets
Designs and executes information security awareness trainings
Prepare proposals for project tenders
Prepare draft and final report for clients
Supervising and lead an in-house IT team

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar discipline
Applicants holding an information security certification (e.g.: CISA, CISM, CISSP, CEH, etc) is preferred
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in the areas of Information Security
Possess knowledge of security principles, techniques and technologies
Good understanding of network protocols, design and operations
Strong leadership, analytical skills and efficient problem solving
Willing to travel within Singapore and overseas
Willingness to learn
Good English communication skills (written and oral)
Able to handle multiple projects concurrently

Required technical skills:

Knowledge of security areas such as information system auditing, penetration test, database security, firewall design and implementation, risk analysis, identity management, access management, or web services
Familiarity with IT processes and security standards and regulations such as ISO 27001/2, COBIT, ITIL, OWASP, CIS, MAS’ TRM Guidelines, PDPA 2012
Vulnerability and threat management experience
Experience with various security tools and products

Relevant experience in Outsourcing/Vendor Risk Governance and Risk Management, good understanding on business/operational risk, IT Risk Management etc. 
Familiar with MAS Outsourcing Guidelines, Technology Risk Management Notices and Guidelines, ABS Guidelines on Controls & Procedures for Outsourced Service Providers etc. 
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Outsourcing/Operational Risk. 
A good team player with good command of English and Mandarin to communicate at all levels. 
A recognised degree in a Technology related or relevant field preferred.

As Assistant Director, General Ledger/Financial Reporting and Policies, the successful candidate will lead a team of finance and accounting staff to ensure that the financial statements of GovTech are drawn up timely for reporting to stakeholders leveraging on the Enterprise Resource Planning System and implement finance policies to ensure adequate check and balance of controls. title: Business Development (‘BD’) Manager – Energy trading company
description:
This is a newly established Singapore office of a privately owned petroleum company. Due to ambitious plans to expand in Asia Pacific, a newly created opportunity for a Business Development Manager has arisen.  The company currently trades actively in naphtha, fuel oil, gasoil and mogas. 
Reporting directly to the Global CEO at head office, the BD manager will be identifying, developing and originating business opportunities in targeted countries within Asia Pacific region, especially in China. This entails the use of market analysis, leads from clients, networking events. The manager will also be the key relationship manager for customers in the Far East, and will negotiate commercial proposals in order to close contracts with oil majors, traders and producers. As the office grows, he/ she will be the key point of coordination between Head office and the Singapore office for operations, finance and risk management. The manager will also assist in the development of trading structures to allow for improved margins. The role may transition into a full fledged trader position.  
The successful candidate will possess a tertiary degree within a finance discipline, with 10-15 years of work experience in energy trading within a business development/ energy trading capacity. It is critical that the candidate has proven track record in naphtha, fuel oil. Due to the business coverage of the office, only candidates with Asian experience with track record covering North Asia (particularly China and Korea) will be considered. 
To apply, please submit your resume to Ailing Huang at ah @kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number AH12143. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified. 
 
Licence No: 16S8060
Registration no: R1104181

title: Temp Finance Officer - AP (7 months, up to $2800, Jalan Buroh)
description:
Responsibilities:Perform Accounts Payable function including process invoices and payments.Assist in month-end closing.Verify and process staff claims for reimbursements.Prepare vendors, intercompany and bank reconciliations.Prepare quarterly GST reporting.Requirements:CAT/Diploma in Accountancy or equivalent.At least 2 years of relevant experience in manufacturing industry.Proficient in MS Office applications.Preferably with experience using SAP system.Strong organizational skills and pay close attention to detail.Able to meet deadlines and work effectively under pressure.Able to start work immediately/short notice will be an advantage.Other Information:5 days work week.Salary will commensurate with experience and qualification.Company transports are provided at designated pickup points. Email Address: os3@capitagrp.comPlease kindly email your resume with current and expected salary, notice period and reason for leaving each job.By submitting your curriculum vitae or personal data to us in connection with your job application, you are deemed to have read and agreed to the terms of our Privacy Policy, and consented to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data by us and our affiliates, in accordance with our Privacy Policy.  Please access our website at www.capitagrp.com for a copy of our Privacy Policy.  If you wish to withdraw your consent, please drop us an email at dataprotection@kellyservices.com.sg to let us know. All resumes and personal particulars sent to the aforementioned email address will NOT be attended to as the address is not for job application purposes.  We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  EA License No.: 08C2893EA Reg.  COMPANY OVERVIEW

Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia. Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs. Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients. Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. In addition, we have also been honoured with the Enterprise 50 award in 2012 as well as the Recruitment Agency of the Year Silver Award (Asia Recruitment Awards, 2015). More information about Capita Pte Ltd is available at www.capitagrp.com and www.facebook.com/capitagrp. By submitting your curricular vitae or personal data to us in connection with your job application, you are deemed to have read and agreed to the terms of our Privacy Policy, and consented to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data by us and our affiliates, in accordance with our Privacy Policy.  Please visit www.capita.com for a copy of our Privacy Policy.  If you wish to withdraw your consent, please drop us an email at dataprotection@kellyservices.com.sg to let us know.

title: AR Analyst
description:
Responsibilities:

Responsible for timely AR (Trade Receivables) collections
Engagements with external customers and internal sales teams to drive AR collections
Drive, monitor, analyse and report AR performance against KPIs

Requirements:

Diploma/ Degree in Business Administration/ Finance or relevant discipline
At least 3 years' working experience in Credit and/or Accounts Receivable fields required
Knowledge in SAP is a definite advantage
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Willing to travel (China and/or South East Asia), depending on work requirement

For more career opportunities, please refer to http://www.asmpacific.com/careers 


 



WORK LOCATION										





Address				
2 Yishun Avenue 7 Singapore 768924










						COMPANY SNAPSHOT			            


					Average Processing Time 


										More Than 2 Weeks					
									


Registration No.

198905407G



Industry
Semiconductor/Wafer Fabrication


Company Size
1001 - 2000 Employees


Working Hours

						Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays					


Dress Code

						Business (e.g. Shirts)					


Benefits

						Medical, Dental, Sports (e.g. Gym), Vision, Flexi Benefit					


Spoken Language

						English					



 


 COMPANY OVERVIEW


ASM Pacific Technology Ltd. was founded in 1975. We are the world's leading supplier of semiconductor assembly and SMT equipment with global presence in more than 30 countries. As a Group that achieved US$1.84 billion in revenue, ASMPT has 10 manufacturing facilities in China, Hong Kong, Germany, Singapore, The Netherlands and United Kingdom.
 
Our core key businesses are the Back-end Equipment, Materials and SMT Solutions. Our Back-end Equipment Segment has been retaining its number one position in the global market since 2002. The SMT Solutions has taken over its peers to become number one in the market while our lead frame business is the world’s fourth biggest supplier. ASMPT’s Back-end Equipment Business offers a diverse product range from bonding to molding and trim & form to the integration of these activities into complete in-line systems for the microelectronics, semiconductor, photonics, and optoelectronics industries. Its Materials Business provides customers with a variety of leadframes such as etched and stamping as well as advanced packaging materials.  ASMPT’ SMT Solutions develops and sells best-in-class DEK printers for the SMT, semiconductor and solar markets as well as best-in-class SIPLACE SMT placement solutions. We have always been committed to R&D as it is one of our competitive edge which supports the growth of our organization. As such, we have six R&D centers worldwide and more than 1,000 patents on key leading edge technologies.
 
ASMPT has been listed in Hong Kong since 1989.
 
Our Awards & Accolades


Awarded the “Caring Company” Logo by the Hong Kong Council of Social Service since 2012


Awarded the “18 Districts Caring Employers” Award in Hong Kong since 2012


10 Best Semiconductor Equipment Supplier Rankings for 2017 by VLSI Customer Satisfaction Survey


Munich factory was awarded Factory of the Year 2016 Award by Produktion/AT Kearney 


Ranked among Top 10 of Best Managed HK Companies in 2016 by Finance Asia


Ranked among Top 10 of Best at Investor Relations in 2016 by Finance Asia


Ranked among Top 5 of the 10 BEST Chip Making Equipment Suppliers in 2016
	by VLSI Customer Satisfaction Survey


Ranked among Top 3 of Assembly Equipment in 2016 by VLSI Customer Satisfaction Survey


Ranked among Top 4 of Test Equipment in 2016 by VLSI Customer Satisfaction Survey


2016 Corporate Governance Asia – Best Investor Relations Company


2015 Hong Kong Awards for Industries - Technology Achievement Grand Award


 
ENABLING THE DIGITAL WORLD is ASMPT’s vision and we believe that TOGETHER,


We have the POWER and Agility to Drive Change


We deliver the highest value and innovative solutions to our customers through products and solutions with advanced technologies and excellent quality


We aspire to make ASMPT a great work place, a great business partner and a great company built to last


 
We welcome talents who share our vision and core values POWER:


Passion to be the #1 “Go to Partner”


Ownership of actions and behaviors


Win with our customers


Excellence in all that we do


Respect for one and all


 
For more information on ASM and its products and services, please visit www.asmpacific.com



 


 WHY JOIN US?


Our employees, being our greatest assets, formed the bedrock of the Group. We believe in nurturing and retaining the right talent through various motivations and retention schemes to support our employees build and strengthen their competencies. Besides offering attractive and competitive remuneration packages, ASMPT also placed great emphasis to provide extensive training programs for our employees. We seek to provide a fun and fulfilling work environment where our employees are motivated and empowered to be innovative.  We also take pride in looking after the well-being of our employees by introducing sports activities and health benefits to promote a healthy lifestyle.

title: Associate, Finance Shared Services Accounts Payable (3-months contract)
description:
You will be responsible for the processing of invoices and staff reimbursements in a prompt and accurate manner. You will also need to ensure that unprocessed invoices are accrued accordingly during month-end and year-end closings. You will need to prepare and post journals when required and maintain and reconcile Accounts Payable related schedules. You are also expected to liaise with both internal and external stakeholders to resolve disputed and/or outstanding invoices.
 
Job Requirements:


Diploma in Accountancy or equivalent (e.g. CAT)


Good interpersonal and communication skills


Team player who is also able to work independently and is meticulous


Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint)


Accounting experience and knowledge of SAP will be an added advantage

description:

Make proposals to allow for correction.Make sure all rules and regulations enforced by Group Corporate Control are applied and adhered to.Produce any profitability analysis as required.Monthly meeting with his management to discuss results.Gap analysis between actual and estimated cost to adjust the standard cost if necessary  SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONSDegree from a recognised universityAt least 3 years’ experience in a similar function preferably from a maritime or financial environment.Ability to engage and build strong work relationships with Operations, Commercial and Management in order to effectively influence and be considered dependable.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Can work independently and in a team environment.Ability to meet deadlines within tight time frames.Good organisational and analytical skills with a mature methodical approach to tasks.Demonstrate ability to solve problems and offer innovative solutions; not afraid of challenges and learning new things.Customer focus yet strong attention to detail.Excellent computer skills, particularly in Microsoft Office (especially in Microsoft Excel).  COMPANY OVERVIEW


	Neptune Orient Lines Limited (NOL) is a global company with core business in container shipping. NOL is part of the CMA CGM Group, a leading worldwide shipping group founded in 1978 by Jacques R. Saadé. CMA CGM has a global presence thanks to its numerous vessels calling various ports all over the world. CMA CGM has grown continuously, and has been constantly innovating to offer its clients new sea, land and logistics solutions. Headquartered in Marseilles, the Group has employees all over the world in hundreds of agencies.

	 

	NOL delivers its quality services through its principal operating brand, APL.

	 

	APL has been facilitating world trade since 1848 and is one of the shipping industry’s leading global brands. APL provides world-class container shipping and terminal services, as well as intermodal operations supported by advanced technology and e-commerce. APL offers transportation for all shipment needs – from dry, climate-controlled, hazardous and oversized goods to special cargo. APL also offers shipping services in the world’s major trade lanes – Trans-Pacific, Trans-Atlantic, Latin-America, Asia-Europe and Intra-Asia.

	Be part of a professional team that delivers innovative and effective solutions to customers all over the world.  At NOL, we look for exceptional individuals and invest in their growth.

This is a business partnering role with good exposure for Big 4 managers seeking for commercial experience in an APAC regional financial analysis role. Client Details Our client is a Blue Chip US Multinational with extensive operations in the Asia Pacific region. Due to rapid expansion, this dynamic and fast-moving organization is seeking a high caliber professional to join them as Senior Financial Analyst. Description Reporting to the Regional Senior FP&A Manager, you will be responsible for the forecasting and analysis of revenue for the Asia Pacific Region. Working in close cooperation with the sales & manufacturing team, you will provide an on going analysis of sell through and channel inventory position across the region. This is a business-oriented role where you will participate proactively in reviewing and recommending effective business practices. Some regional travel will be required. Profile You should ideally be a Accounting degree qualified with at least 5-7 years experience either in Big 4 and/or commercial experience in a manufacturing set-up. Good commercial acumen and excellent interpersonal skills is critical to the success of this role. Candidates need to have a good understanding of manufacturing costing concepts either through external audit portfolio or commercial experience. Job Offer The successful candidate can look forward to an attractive remuneration package and developing a rewarding career in a blue chip, dynamic and fast-growing business. To apply online please click the Apply button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Jessly Chew (Lic No: R1549000) on +65 6416 9869

title: Account And Administration Executive (Treasury)
description:
Job Description *Primary Objective- Treasury Managment System ("TMS") operator role- Maintenance of TMS master date- Transactional banking and related group companies - FX settlements with banks and related group companies - Maintain internal relationships to improve treasury awareness and controls- Assist timely processing of daily banking transactions- Accounting related to the above transactions - Office administrative works *Primary Responsibilities  Bank accounts• Administration of all the bank accounts of Company including opening and closing accounts and changing account settings as required.• Monitor balances of all the bank accounts by obtaining the daily bank statements and anticipating scheduled transactions so that all the bank balances are effectively controlled. If negative balances are anticipated, consult with the Accounting and Transaction Manager for possible actions and follow up.• File daily bank statements. Treasury• Collect daily cash forecast from the related group companies.• Prepare remittance and transfer application using web banking system for approval• Custody of petty cash.• Custody of safety box (checking and updating the list of valuables) Accounting• Enter transactional banking data into TMS and SAP.• Settle and clear A/R and A/P including preparing invoices in SAP.• Accounting of fund management and FX transactions Taxation• File the quarterly GST using the e-tax system Office• Office admin duties (filing, document control, expense claim) Job Requirment • Prefer Diplomat or above in accounting, finance, banking or commerce related degree.• Prefer has relevant working experience.• Willing to do administration work.• Proven track record with the following- Communication- Time management- Detail-oriented• IT literacy is necessary.• MS Office is must.• Skilled SAP ECC 6.0 is considered a plus  Interested applicants pls send in a copy of your resume with your current, expected salaries and availability in Microsoft Word format to See Wei (R1551122) seewei@pasona.com.sg for immediate processing. Kindly indicate in your email subject title as " Job Application for 6319 Account And Administration Executive (Treasury)" . Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.Thank you.

title: PARALEGAL (IMMIGRATION & CORPORATE)
description:
As an Immigration and Corporate Paralegal in the Legal Department, you will use your customer service orientation to provide high quality and timely support to team members and Business Units in Singapore and Malaysia, other countries in Asia, and elsewhere.  In this role you must develop highly effective working relationships with operational managers and team members from many sites and countries.•Immigration:  The majority of your work will concern immigration.  You will work closely with the corporate immigration team, acting as the Company’s Singapore representative on immigration issues of any sort, regarding any country.  You will assist supervisors planning assignments to Singapore (the subsidiary company is called “MSA”) and Muar, Malaysia (“MMY”).  You will assist team members from around the world who need work permits or visas for their proposed activities in Singapore and Malaysia.  You will support MSA and MMY team members who need visas to travel to many countries.  You will work closely with vendor firms that assist MSA and MMY to arrange work permits and visas to Singapore, Malaysia, and many countries around the world. •Corporate Paralegal Work:  You also will devote a substantial part of your time to corporate law.  You will assist your supervising attorney with a broad scope of projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Singapore and Malaysia Visas and Admission (without visa):•Provide Guidance:  via email, telephone, etc., to travelers from around the world who soon will travel to Singapore or Malaysia on business.  A key responsibility will be to provide guidance on Singapore’s work permit exempt activity (WPEA) and training employment pass (TEP) rules, required of many travelers who expect a simple business visitor visa or admission to Singapore.•Interface with Vendor Firm in Malaysia: that provides employment pass and other support to international visitors to Malaysia. Work with HR in Malaysia to assist travelers to receive required documents and information regarding MMY.  •Interface with Vendor Law Firm:  that provides WPEA and TEP support to international visitors to Singapore.  •Traditional Visas:  Issue letters of Introduction (ICA Form V39A) to visa applicants from sites around the world, using your NRIC number (wherever applicable).•eVisas:  After obtaining required information from the traveler at a site abroad, use your NRIC number to log-on to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs website to provide the information needed for issuance of an eVisa. Outgoing Visas:•Provide Guidance and Assistance:  via email, telephone, etc., to travelers in Singapore and Malaysia who soon will travel to other countries on business.  Assist team members to understand the visa requirements of many countries as posted on the websites of the appropriate Embassies and the Micron Legal Department.  Represent  Legal’s Immigration Group by providing wide-ranging assistance to ensure compliance with immigration law of the countries in question in visa and work permit situations.•U.S. Training Visas:  Assist the Legal Department to have MSA or MMY team members interact with Legal and vendor firms to prepare application packets and request J-1 exchange visitor visas at the U.S. Embassies in Singapore or Kuala Lumpur.•U.S. Work Visas:  Assist vendor law firm as necessary in having MSA or MMY team members interact with Legal and vendor firms to request to prepare application packets and request L-1 intracompany transferee visas to the U.S.•Worldwide Business Visitor Visas:  Assist team members to communicate with visa service agencies or vendor law firm, or to apply directly at the appropriate Embassies in Singapore or Kuala Lumpur.  Assist team members to obtain company letters from HR that confirm current employment with MSA or MMY. Employment and Training Passes: •Singapore:  Assist vendor law firm with the actions that the client company must take, such as posting advertisements in the National Job Bank prior to MOM issuance of employment passes.•Malaysia:  Assist vendor firm with the actions that the client company must take for incoming expats and other assignees to receive employment or similar passes. Corporate Paralegal Work:•Support Singapore Attorneys in opening matter-specific files, maintaining Singapore corporate filing records, filing corporate secretarial records with ACRA and performing office administrative and secretarial work;•Reviewing, amending and conducting basic due diligence on corporate commercial documents;•Other responsibilities may include, under supervision of the responsible Singapore Attorneys, attending internal meetings with the business teams, communicating with counterparties and/or their legal counsel via conference calls and e-mails. Requirements•Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.•2 or more years of experience in an office – either private sector or government-- that provides customer services to many applicants facing time deadlines, such as law firms, visa services agencies, travel agencies, MOM, ICA, EDB, etc.•Proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel.•Excellent communications skills; both verbal and written.•Ability to forge strong and effective working relationships across a variety of stakeholder groups.•Ability to work independently, under pressure and to meet deadlines.•Flexibility towards continually changing environment and reporting needs.•Continuously work to improve existing processes.•Excellent teamwork, communication, and business partnering skills.
