 COMPANY PHOTOS
























 


 COMPANY OVERVIEW


	Micron Semiconductor Asia is a subsidiary of Micron Technology, Inc.  (‘Micron’). 
	
		 

		Micron is a global leader in the semiconductor industry. For more than 35 years, Micron has dedicated itself to collaborating with customers and partners to engineer technology that drives innovation and transforms what’s possible.  Micron offers the industry’s broadest portfolio of silicon-to-semiconductor memory solutions—starting with foundational DRAM, NAND, and NOR Flash memory, and extending to SSDs, modules, MCPs, HMC, and other semiconductor systems. This best-in-class technology powers leading-edge computing, consumer, enterprise server and storage, networking, embedded, automotive, industrial, and mobile products.

		 

		Micron is strategically located in Singapore to efficiently and effectively accommodate its global customers, while also serving as the base of the company’s worldwide operations. Singapore is home to Micron’s largest manufacturing footprint with three fabrication facilities, an upcoming fabrication facility expansion, and a test and assembly facility. Its presence in Singapore also includes a technology center supporting innovation across the company and a sales and marketing office that offers all Micron memory products to our regional customers.

		 

		Micron provides opportunities for team members’ personal and career development through challenging work assignments, training and educational programs. We hire, train, develop, and educate a workforce that is competent in performing job expectations by providing orientation, job specific training, professional certifications, external training and various continuous learning opportunities.

		As Micron enters into a new era of growth, its presence in Singapore plays an important role in its worldwide operations and overall success.


	 



 


 WHY JOIN US?



		What we value in our team members echoes what our customers value most in our company. As Micron team members, here’s how we strive to grow this value in our everyday jobs:

		 

Be Innovative
		As one of the most prolific patent holders in the world, we continually rethink, recast, and advance our ideas—so we're constantly creating new possibilities for leading-edge technologies.

		 

Be Trusted
		Some of the world’s most trusted brands rely on us to help their products soar to new heights. We couldn’t build this kind of trust without the integrity of our team members coupled with their vast industry experience and technology expertise.

		 

Be Collaborative
		They say two heads are better than one—and we agree! Since first opening our doors in 1978, we’ve been dedicated to truly collaborating with our coworkers as well as our customers and partners to engineer technology that drives innovation forward.

		 

Be Driven
		We value determination and drive in our team members—and their follow-through has been inspiring. We’ve got 26,000+ lifetime patents, hundreds of industry-leading awards, and an incredibly bright future to show for it.

title: Investment Banking (Sales & Trading) Audit Manager
description:
An opportunity for a qualified Internal Audit professional to undertake a role within the Markets audit team.  Your new company This is a global bank with strong presence in Singapore and a stable Financial Markets business  Your new role You will lead, conduct and report on audit assignments in accordance with the bank's Internal Audit guidelines to facilitate business activities in a risk-controlled environment. You will perform special reviews on an ad-hoc basis and validate the implementation status of recommendations issued as a result of your findings. You will also assist in conducting annual risk assessments and periodic reporting to Head Office. Lastly, you will regularly meet stakeholders to build on-going relationships with them and engage with the business to resolve problems and ensure the smooth running of audit activities.  What you'll need to succeed The ideal candidate will be an experienced banking internal audit professional with a good understanding of investment banking products and experience gained within an investment bank. Strong grasp of financial markets products is absolutely essential. As this role will be high-profile, excellent communication and report writing skills and superior stakeholder management skills are a pre-requisite.  What you'll get in return You will get the opportunity to join a bank in their global audit team.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. description:
Job Responsibilities:

Supporting the Business and Management in terms of providing information and analytics
Controllership function – Check and Balance
Direct the accounting and financial function of the group business unit to ensure accurate and timely recording and reporting of operating results.
Manage the accounting team and review work done by subordinates to ensure the completeness. 
Responsible for month-end closing
Preparation of monthly financial report, including assurance of accurate and timely result.
Preparation of monthly cash flow forecasts, variance analysis, costing/margin analysis report to support business planning objective
Ensure integrity of GL and timely closing of accounts.


Inventory control and Waste Management.
Filling of statutory, business statistics and other types of return as required by local tax and legal legislations. (GST, Corporate Tax, Audit and etc.)
Liaising with suppliers and external auditor, coordinate with the tax agent on tax compliance, as well as ensure that all accounting activities comply with the accounting policies and Singapore Financial Reporting Standards (SFRS).
Support/Work closely with Operations in related accounting tasks. Giving advice and guidance on all financial matter to the business operation. 
Direct the development and implementation of processes and procedures to improve effectiveness and efficiency of the finance operation.
Financing 
Other ad-hoc assignment as required.

Job Requirements:

Diploma/ Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy with minimum of 2 years of Financial Analysis, Accounting, Consolidation work experience;
Accounting in F&B environment preferred;
Proficient in MS Office application;
Meticulous and with good organization and presentation skills;


To have a willingness to mentor and guide others;
Dynamic and able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.

There are many benefits and advantages in joining us:

Multi-cultural work environment;
Dedicated training programs;
A highly motivated team;
Firm commitment to the development of careers.

 
Be part of the Award Winning Team! Join Us!
 
Interested candidates please email your comprehensive resume with photo & expected salary.
 
Only successful applicants will be notified.

1-GROUP
 The 1-Group (formerly known as 1-Rochester Group) has embarked on an exciting expansionary plan. In addition to the group's two highly popular and award winning venues; One Rochester and 1-Altitude, the group has recently rolled out 4 more new iconic venues namely; Monti at The Fullerton Pavilion (on Marina Bay, Singapore’s most iconic dining and Jazz venue ), Pen & Inc (Singapore’s first authentic licensed live music bar in a tertiary institution), The Garage (European Bistronomy restaurant situated in Singapore’s only UNESCO site, Botanic Gardens) and The Summerhouse (Singapore most popular farm to table concept restaurant situated at Seletar Aerospace Park).  All these 6 characteristic and unique sites hold a portfolio of Lifestyle F&B businesses each. In addition to these F&B businesses, the 1-Group’s event arm, 1-HOST, is renowned for its signature events and weddings. 1-Host is Singapore’s largest wedding planner. The 1-Group is on its way to become the Lifestyle F&B leader in the region.  
Over a decade, the group has entrenched its motto of “Hosting Great Memories”.  It continues to be dedicated to provide exceptional guest experiences in different ways across its portfolio. The group has won many international awards and accolades for its concept, food, service and ambience.
The group owns its own unique and proprietary management systems trademarked under the names c-Leadership (“Collective-Leadership”) and r-ManagementSystem. The group's leadership style has been thoroughly researched upon and its findings are published in a business academic book called “remote-Entrepreneurship”. The concepts in this book are now being studied by 6 universities and its experience and story has also been turned into a case study.
With the growing portfolio, the 1-Group is looking for more talented individual to join its expanding team.  It is an opportunity to develop your career and join the collective-Leaders of 1-Group!  If you are entrepreneurial, creative, spirited, a team player and are the best in what you do, 1-Group is looking for you!

title: Regional Finance Manager (Group Corporate Reporting)
description:
The CompanyOur client is a leader in the manufacture, installation and project management of industrial equipment. As part of their expansion plans, they are seeking a Finance Manager for the Emerging Markets region. The RoleReporting to the VP Finance, you will work independently to support group and corporate HQ reporting for the Emerging Markets region which includes China, India, Oceania, Middle East, Africa and Greater Asia. You will work closely with the finance teams across the region for the consolidation of financial reports including but not limited to monthly closing review as well as quarter/annual consolidation. You will ensure all corporate level reporting requirements are met and take the lead in rolling out new policies and reporting requirements in the region.This is a highly visible role within the organization and you will have the opportunity to partner closely with the senior management team to provide analysis and support for a fast growing region. You will be involved in the analysis of overall business performance, preparation of business review, operating plan, budgeting, forecasting as well as variance analysis for the Emerging Markets business. You will also support to the business via deep dive analysis of the Order Books, Sales and Margins for the Emerging Markets business. Your ProfileAs the successful candidate, you will have a degree in accountancy with at least 5 - 8 years of relevant experience. Prior regional exposure in working in a US MNC environment and familiarity with Hyperion, US GAAP/SOX will be essential. Experience within a project / engineering environment with exposure to project accounting/costing will be an advantage.Apply TodayPlease send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number STE9315377, by clicking the apply button. title: Finance and Human Resources Operation Specialist
description:
Your principal duties will be related to:

To support the department head and the team with all HR and financial related issues.
Ensure all required records are kept current and any statutory returns completed in a timely manner. 
To monitor the administrative tasks of colleagues in his/her area and to optimize processes.
Identify potential impacts and implications in the handover from one function to another, propose amendments to enable optimal flow from an E2E perspective. 
Carry out all tasks in HR related to employment- and termination formalities, salaries and general HR matters. 
Carry out all tasks in Financial and Sales Accounting within given guidelines and coordinate all accounting tasks within his/her area and will ensure accuracy and accountability of information. 

Experience and Qualifications:
Technical Competences

Relevant university degree in legal, finance and/or HR, Business Administration alternatively CPA with experience in HR and Administration.
Preferably 2-3 years of related experience, ideally in the areas of solution provider in HR, Finance and Admin. 
New graduates are welcome to apply with relevant educational experience.
Good knowledge of MS Office applications as well as SAP
excellent knowledge of English both written and spoken 

Personal Competences

Problem solution-oriented, with strength in taking responsibility for actions and effectively drive operational complex cases.
High level of structured thinking and multi-tasking capabilities paired with ability to resolve problems with proactive and creative approach in all circumstances
Excellent communication, analytical and strategic skills and maturity in dealing with senior management, authorities and colleagues.
ability to instruct colleagues in technical matters
Leadership personality with natural authority as well as a professional and self- confident and well groomed appearance
Ability to quickly adapt and attain a high level of understanding of company’s complexity and international culture.
team player
ability to make ad-hoc decisions
ability to recognize the contextual relations of facts and their consequences within an employment situation
flexibility and cooperative conduct
discretion and sensitivity

Environmental influences or other encumbrances: 

Working with computer
Working under time pressure

If this is you, please submit your detailed resume with including current and expected salary via APPLY NOW.
We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Please submit your application not exceeding 2 MB.                                jobsDB will send your application for review directly to                                Lufthansa German Airlines                  Career Level               Entry Level                Yr(s) of Exp               2 years experience                Qualification             Degree              Company Industry      Job Function   >  >  >     Salary negotiable             Salary negotiable                           Employment Type           Full Time, Permanent                            About                     Lufthansa German Airlines               Lufthansa is one of the world’s leading airlines. As an internationally-operating aviation Group, Deutsche Lufthansa is active in five business fields: Passenger Transportation, Logistics, MRO, Catering and IT Services. More than 400 subsidiaries and holding companies also belong to the Group. The airline offers more than 210 destinations in approximately 80 countries using currently around 700 aircrafts; more than 400 are used for Lufthansa German Airlines. Around 100 million passengers worldwide place their trust in us each year. The dedication, skills and excellent service of more than 120 000 employees from almost 150 nations everywhere in the world is one of our greatest strengths. 
The Finance and HR Operation Specialist is responsible for supporting the HR and Finance team ad hoc on administrative needs for daily operations, programs and initiatives. He/she carries out all HR and Finance tasks in his/her area within the given guidelines and in agreement with SIN CA/L. He/she is responsible for the completion of all administrative tasks and for the regional coordination of all HR and financial issues in his/her area. Upon success, eventually the selected candidate will be given the opportunity to lead the efforts to constantly improve the team's administrative processes, workflows and establish guidelines for overall efficiency.      Website

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.                                jobsDB will send your application for review directly to                                Faith Methodist Church                  Yr(s) of Exp               5 years experience                Qualification             Diploma              Company Industry      Job Function   >  >  >     Salary negotiable             Salary provided                           Employment Type           Full Time            Benefits  Medical insurancePerformance bonus                    About                     Faith Methodist Church               Faith Methodist Church had its beginnings in 1966 as a Methodist Chapel to serve the residents of Queenstown. Before the church building was completed, worship services were conducted in the open air and later in a temporary shed.  
In 1967, with God’s enabling, the founding pastor of Faith Methodist Church, Rev T.C Nga and his team saw to the completion of the church building, which we share with our sister Chinese Methodist Church. The church was named Faith Methodist Church in honour of God’s faithfulness in the entire project and in memory of Faith Goh, the only daughter of Dr Goh & Mrs Goh Kok Kee, who were gracious donors to the church building fund.  
By God's faithfulness, Faith's membership grew and the church facilities were inadequate to meet the needs of the congregation. Hence, the church building was redeveloped from 2002 to 2003.  
Today, the church building houses a 1000-seat sanctuary, 800-seat worship hall, two levels of parking, as well as a kindergarten, playground, library and a columbarium. The building is also equipped with lifts and ramps to cater to seniors who are mobility-challenged.  
From 38 attendees when it first started, Faith’s congregation has grown to some 2,000+ today.  
Commitment to community outreach and missions is at the heart of Faith. From the setting up of Lakeside Family Centre, Jurong Preaching Point (now Agape Methodist Church) and FaithActs community service agency, to active involvement in international ministry in the regions beyond, by God’s grace, Faith is still transforming lives and changing the world for Christ after four decades. description:
Responsible for full set of accounts but not limited to the following fro group companies:-

(ii) Perform month-end closing for group companies by stipulated deadline of the following month.

Audit and commerical experience advantageous.

Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
Independent, pro-active and thrive in a dynamic and result-oriented environment.
Effective communication skills.
Excellent analytical and interpersonal skills with strong problem solving capabilities.

Supporting tax initiatives/enhancements, including:

Refine indirect process manuals developed in conjunction with indirect tax advisors and AFS
Prepare/update tax decision trees for AP and GL usage purposes

Effectively tracking and managing key enterprise direct and indirect tax risks, including the risk of non-compliance.
Ensuring timely:

Payments of direct and indirect tax liabilities
Submission of refund claims

Proactively monitoring direct and indirect tax legislation/policy impacting designated subsidiaries, including any potential required changes to processes and the SAP system.
Developing and maintaining relationships with local tax authorities and advisors.
Ability to provide local country support for direct and indirect taxes regarding the execution of business transactions.
Experience in developing, maintaining and delivering guidance on the correct treatment of direct and indirect taxes for financial statement purposes.
Ability to provide direct and indirect tax support on new business initiatives, contracts, M&A, and tax controversy for relevant JAPAC subsidiaries.

title: Accounts Executive
description:
Job Description:

Assist the Finance Manager in all aspects of accounting and financial matters, which include the year-end audit procedures, quarterly GST reporting, verification of income tax comps, and the preparation of various reports / responses to government stat boards
Perform daily accounting duties (Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, staff claims and petty cash reimbursement)
Handle accounting functions including data entry to computerized accounting system, posting of journals entries (accruals, provisions and prepayments entries) as well as accurate and timely month end closing
Verify the transactions are posted to appropriate accounts and ensure all payments are properly authorized
Test, document, report and monitor controls as per the Internal Control systems on frequent basis. Implement corrective actions as per management
Prepare balance sheet schedules : Fixed assets, prepayments, accruals, reconciliations of inter-company transactions and balances, inventories & etc
Prepare AP & AR aging records
Prepare statement of accounts and monitor accounts receivable, cash flow management and manage vendor payment request
Undertake other ad-hoc reports or duties as required by Finance/Admin Manager

Requirements:

Diploma in Accountancy / LCCI /CAT / ACCA / other relevant qualification in Accounting
At least 5 years of relevant experience in full set of accounts is preferred
Able to work independently and a team player
Ability to multi-task, meticulous and high attention to detail
Possess good work ethic
Innovative and able to adapt to industry changes
Computer literate, strong working knowledge of MS Office (excel with PivotTables and VLookup)
Familiar with SAP Business1
Prior some Admin/Account/HR experience shall be an advantage.
Able to start work with short notice / immediately 

Other Information:

Location: Novena
Monday ~Friday : 08:30~17:30
Salary Range : Negotiable (salary will commensurate according to experience & qualifications)

 
Interested candidates please click on APPLY NOW and submit your detailed resume, current & expected salary, and date available.

We are looking for candidates with 8 years experience in business risk management preferably in Private Banking and Investment Banking with product knowledge (FX, structured products) and familiar with Risk Framework and implementing Risk projects.              100% Client Focused, Proven Trust & Integrity
SearchAsia is a prominent human capital consulting firm with a strong Asia Pacific presence.
Our commitment to our clients is to go beyond recruitment and into business partnership; we take pride in representing our clients and are proactive in participating in your growth. By providing thought leadership and guidance, we assist our business partners to navigate and manage the lucrative, but highly complex and uncertain, markets of Asia Pacific.
To our candidates, we believe in forging long-term relationships with you beyond providing career opportunities. Our consultants strive to have a complete understanding of every candidate's needs, career objectives and motivations, and continue to help you build and manage your careers.

EA Licence No.: 16S8107    Executive Headhunter - Banking & Finance     17-Jun-17  jobsDB Ref. JSG400003003241792 EA License No 16S8107         Tools                 SearchAsia is hiring!
SearchAsia is an established talent-based company that provides headhunting services within various industries.  We have good knowledge of the major companies and have built long-term relationships with various personnel within the corporate world.
SearchAsia offers excellent opportunities for those who wish to have clear, transparent and progressive career paths. In this meritocratic environment, we strongly believe in promoting and rewarding those who have displayed the professional maturity and confidence with the commensurate performance achievements.
Consistent performance and the proven ability to manage a portfolio of steady clients over the first one to two years will earn the Consultant the chance to mentor and lead his or her own team.
Join us as an Executive Headhunter - Banking & Finance today!

Good interpersonal skill
Keen interest in sales and business development
Experience as a Recruitment Consultant is not a must

Outstanding consultants can look forward to relocating to work in our regional offices
Interested candidates should send a detailed resume Microsoft Word Document format

title: Contract Compliance Officer
description:
Job Description:
Be part of the APAC FATCA Diligent Review Taskforce to perform a due diligence review and documentation of existing clients information in accordance with requirements set out in the FATCA Regulations
Specific Tasks:


Execute the FATCA Diligent Review Program based on the FATCA Diligent Review Action Plan


Perform search and review of existing client information based on a given set of criterion


Interacting with regional FATCA Diligent Review Lead, Local Compliance Officers, Operations, Tax, Legal and IT for co-ordination of task force activities and support requirements


Providing regular updates and reports to the Regional FATCA Diligent Review Lead and Local Compliance Officers


Perform ad-hoc additional FATCA tasks and duties, when required


 
Position Requirements:


Ability to work with large data files and extract required details


Capable of effectively co-ordinate and perform multiple functions of the task force


Possess excellent organizational skills, attention to details and ability to prioritize key tasks


Possess strong inter-personal and communication skills


Ability to work in teams, but also capable of working independently


Ability to deal with competing and changing work demands


Fluency in English, both verbal and written is essential


Proficient with the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook)


 
Qualifications/Experience:


University degree preferred


1-2 years in relevant experience as well as project management experience


Knowledge of the local regulatory requirements is an advantage

title: Internal Control & Internal Audit Manager
description:
Haier is the number one brand of Major Appliances in the world with 9.7 percent of global market share. Headquartered in Qingdao, Haier has over 80,000 employees across 30 countries in the world.
 
Haier Singapore is one of the holding companies under Haier Group.  As the integrated regional centre, Haier Singapore is the main platform to provide Internal Control & Audit, procurement, trading, R&D and big data supports to over 80 countries in Asia, Europe, Africa and North America markets.
 
Haier Group has exceeded US$29 billion in revenue and Haier Singapore has achieved the revenue of US$1.9 billion in 2016.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Based in Singapore, you will be part of the global internal control & audit team and provide risk management, compliance and audit services to Haier businesses in the world, including:


Plan and lead internal controls and audit projects deliver sound business recommendations to the involved entities or business units;


Provide coaching and guidance to fellow team members in the execution of their professional activities ;


Assist the Internal Control & Audit Director in other department management matters, such as budgeting, annual work plan developing, management reporting and communication and stakeholder management.


KEY REQUIREMENTS
The ideal candidates we are looking for should be seasoned ICIA auditor with:


Degree in Accounting and Finance, or its equivalent.


Minimum of 6 years of audit experience with a combination of in-house or big 4 outsourced IA role.


Experienced in a controllership function will also be considered.


Familiar with Consumer Electronics, FMCG industry with a sound knowledge in manufacturing, sales processes, procurement and related internal controls will be considered favourably.


With ACCA, CPA or CIA accreditations will be considered favourably.


Demonstrated experience in leading team on risk management, internal control or/and internal audit projects.


Good team player.


Proactive attitude and willingness to learn.


Excellent English abilities as well as ability to speak, read and write business Chinese to liaise with Mandarin speaking clients.

 COMPANY OVERVIEW

Formerly known as the SAF Non-Commissioned Officers (NCO) Club, The SAF Warrant Officers And Specialists Club's history stretches back to the post-war era.
 
In 1951, the British Armed Services set up the Britannia Club as a recreational place for their servicemen and the allied troops. The club soon became a popular social gathering venue as it provided opportunities for soldiers from diverse backgrounds and nationalities to interact and share experiences.
 
In 1971, the club was handed back to the Singapore government, which was subsequently handed over to the SAF, and in 1974, the SAF NCO Club was formed. The club housed many prominent features, such as the SAF Enterprise (SAFE) Superstore, which offered affordable merchandise and payment schemes for the NCOs. Over the years, the club became increasingly family-oriented and it constantly strived to create opportunities for members to bond and enjoy leisure activities.
 
With the restructuring of the NCO Corps in 1994, the club was renamed the SAF Warrant Officers & Specialists Club. Due to the expansion of the membership base and the allocation of land for redevelopment, the club was relocated to Jurong East and was officially opened on 8 February 2002; with the new identity known as THE CHEVRONS.
 
Our Mission
We create memorable experiences for our members, their families and friends to build esprit de corps and forge closer ties.
 
Our Vision
To be the pride of our members and the SAF; always innovating, always striving to be the best!
 
Core Values
These core values emphasise the club's commitment in carrying out its mission.
Known as P-R-I-D-E, these are the guiding principles that we embrace:

Promote Professionalism by paying attention to members' interests.
Respect the members' feedback and their views.
Instill a spirit of sharing, learning and co-operation among the staff and members.
Deliver quality customer service by discerning members' needs.
Express our commitment by embracing the core values.


 



 


 WHY JOIN US?

Here are just a few reasons why you should join us:

1. CULTURE
At THE CHEVRONS, there is high cohesiveness among us as we work closely, and progress as a team. More uniquely, working in a recreation club is an entirely different experience as we provide you with a resort-style work environment. 
 
2. PEOPLE
Being a multi-nationality club, you will get to work with people from diverse backgrounds and learn from one another. Not only is there an influx of creative new ideas to help the club excel; it makes THE CHEVRONS a fun place to work in.
 
3. SERVICE-ORIENTED
We take pride in serving our members and guests, and believe in going the extra mile to deliver excellent service. 
 
4. CAREER ADVANCEMENT
A fun, enriching and fulfilling career starts with us. We offer you opportunities to learn and grow through training courses, on-the-job training and support from your peers, supervisors and managers. 
 
5. BENEFITS & REWARDS
Our staff will enjoy a full range of comprehensive and attractive benefits.

ROLE/JOB SUMMARY: Lead and maintain the fixed assets register in term of Capitalization, Disposal and monthly depreciations.  Lead in the preparation of information and submission for Government Grants. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: • Lead and maintain fixed assets register including but not limited to AUC Accounting, Capitalisation, Acquisitions, Disposals, Allocations and perform depreciation computation. • Work with REC Project Team to ensure compliance with local GAAP for accounting of fixed assets• Responsible for the preparation of information and ensure timely Government Grants submission• Lead monthly/quarterly/yearly reporting of fixed assets and Government Grants, including preparation of monthly fixed assets and Government Grants schedules• Assist in ad hoc request/analysis on fixed assets expenditure and Government Grants• Liaise with Auditors on year end fixed assets sighting and audit of Government Grants• Participate in ERP accounting systems improvement and enhancement projects• Other ad hoc assignments REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:• Bachelor Degree in Accountancy/ACCA with at least 5 years of related accounting experience, preferably in a manufacturing environment• Strong working knowledge and understanding of various Government Grants• Hands-on knowledge of ERP accounting systems (preferably SAP) and strong Excel skills• High energy and drive, with a positive and proactive attitude• A team player and able to work in a team environment• Able to handle large transactions volume for fixed assets and Grants• Strong interpersonal skills and able to communicate with people at all levels

Celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2016, REC is a leading European brand of solar panels. title: Head Accountant
description:
Company ProfileSeries Of Intentions (SOI) is the group behind the Kilo restaurants in Singapore and Bali, Kilo Lounge, Camp Kilo Charcoal Club, and Grain Traders. Officially founded in 2011, along with the opening of Kilo Kallang in Singapore, SOI has its roots in the now-defunct Raw Kitchen Bar in Bukit Timah, which opened in 2008. On a surface level, SOI is an F&B group—our restaurants form the platform that give the company its life—but the group’s intentions extend beyond dining and nightlife. We organize events such as pop-ups, block parties, dialogue sessions, kitchen takeovers, and more, and we pride ourselves on being involved in every element in the conceptualizing of each concept: from interior and graphic design, to menu creation and direction, operation standards, and marketing and management.Kilo was the initial intention; the word itself means "we wish to communicate with you”, and this extends to everything that we do. description:

Accounting of sales, purchases & expenses in Tally accounting software.

Resolve accounting discrepancies and irregularities in consultation with auditors and associated parties.
Liaise with auditors, management, tax advisors, banks and counterparties as required.
Preparation of time charter invoices.
Analysis and accounting of reports from ship management companies.
Timely computation and coordination of payment of WHT payable.

Other duties as required.

Accounting degree/diploma or equivalent.
Knowledge of generally accepted accounting practices and principles.

Minimum of 4 years of experience in the accounting of business transactions, management of financial systems and budgets, financial reporting, financial data analysis, auditing and taxation.
Familiarity with commodity trading and shipping.

Excellent attention to detail with data maintenance and reporting.
Problem identification, analysis and resolution.
Good planning, organisational and time management ability.

title: Head (Finance - Shared Service Fixed Assets)
description:
The Finance Division supports senior management in the areas of cost and budgetary control and in ensuring
compliance with prevailing policies by government ministries and A*STAR. It also sets financial policies and guidelines,
and provides timely management information towards better resource management. It adds value to A*STAR and
A*STAR-funded entities by delivering a range of financial management services.
 

JOB DESCRIPTION
• Manage and oversee the daily operations of the Fixed Assets (FA) function
• Ensure consistent and accurate reporting of fixed assets
• Ensure periodic fixed asset count is performed and assets records are reconciled in a timely manner
• Supervise and guide to a team of FA staff in meeting the Service Level Agreement (SLA)
• Review, align and improve on existing FA SOPs as well as processes for the FA shared service
• Ensure adherence with the organisation’s financial policies and guidelines.
• Monthly management reporting
• Other ad-hoc duties
 

JOB REQUIREMENTS
• Degree in Accountancy or equivalent professional qualification
• 8 to 10 year of relevant experience, with relevant fixed asset management and accounting experience
• Good working knowledge in GST
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
• Strong people management, communication and organizational skills
• Proficient in SAP and electronic assets application systems would be advantageous
• Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects required

 COMPANY OVERVIEW

The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and Research Institutes, the wider research community and industry. A*STAR oversees 18 biomedical sciences and physical sciences and engineering research entities primarily located in Biopolis and Fusionopolis.

For more information on A*STAR, please visit www.a-star.edu.sg.



 


 WHY JOIN US?


At A*STAR, you will be part of a vibrant and innovative team, dedicated to drive A*STAR’s mission to advance science and develop innovative technology to further economic growth and improve lives.  
 
We firmly believe that people are our greatest asset.  
 
We recruit the best from all cultures, nationalities and academic disciplines, invest in, and develop them to their fullest potential. We welcome you to take up the challenge, to contribute and make a difference to Singapore’s future.    
 
We offer a wide range of job opportunities, both in the scientific and non-scientific fields; from research positions at all levels in a wide range of biomedical, scientific and engineering fields to management and administrative positions essential to ensure the smooth running of the research institutes.
 
For research jobs, we welcome applications from scientists at all stages of their careers, from those just finishing their graduate studies to senior established scientists.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Description As a Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for all aspects of financial analysis, planning and reporting on fab operating expenses and unit costs, capital expenditure and scenario planning.  You will partner closely with finance and other cross-functional teams in the reviews of actual and forecasted data as well as participate in the fab budgeting process.  You will also be a key financial resource to support site operations in understanding their operating expenses, evaluation of capital projects and scenarios. Responsibilities•Collect and organize required Corporate Metric Data•Monthly review, analysis and report of actual costs and comparison to plan and prior period performance•Quarterly review, analysis and report of forecasted costs and comparison to prior forecast(s)•Prepare and present business results and projections to management team•Provide support/assistance to cost centre managers with respect to expense planning, cost control and variance reporting•Ongoing support of management information requests and special projects as assigned by management.•Establish a strong understanding of fab financials and cost drivers to provide effective analysis and help drive good business decisions and competitive costs (include benchmarking, identification of cost saving opportunities through data and metrics).•Continuous review of financial analysis methods, tools, product cost allocation model and processes; implement improvements as needed in order to improve the quality of analysis.•Continuously work to improve the coordination and communication among site finance teams, Singapore Shared Services Centre (SSC) as well as Worldwide Operation Finance team.•Build and maintain effective customer relationships. Requirements•Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance•Minimum 2 years of Accounting or Finance experience•Prior work experience in the Semiconductor industry and/or manufacturing operations is a plus•Proficient in ERP systems (such as SAP), Microsoft Office suite and database applications (such as Cognos)•Strong analytical and problem-solving skills•Planning, reporting and/or financial modeling experience•Experience in partnering with Operations and Finance teams•Excellent verbal and written communications skills•Ability to work independently, under pressure and meet deadlines in a rapidly changing environment•Organized and detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy

 COMPANY PHOTOS
























 


 COMPANY OVERVIEW


	Micron Semiconductor Asia is a subsidiary of Micron Technology, Inc.  (‘Micron’). 
	
		 

		Micron is a global leader in the semiconductor industry. For more than 35 years, Micron has dedicated itself to collaborating with customers and partners to engineer technology that drives innovation and transforms what’s possible.  Micron offers the industry’s broadest portfolio of silicon-to-semiconductor memory solutions—starting with foundational DRAM, NAND, and NOR Flash memory, and extending to SSDs, modules, MCPs, HMC, and other semiconductor systems. This best-in-class technology powers leading-edge computing, consumer, enterprise server and storage, networking, embedded, automotive, industrial, and mobile products.

		 

		Micron is strategically located in Singapore to efficiently and effectively accommodate its global customers, while also serving as the base of the company’s worldwide operations. Singapore is home to Micron’s largest manufacturing footprint with three fabrication facilities, an upcoming fabrication facility expansion, and a test and assembly facility. Its presence in Singapore also includes a technology center supporting innovation across the company and a sales and marketing office that offers all Micron memory products to our regional customers.

		 

		Micron provides opportunities for team members’ personal and career development through challenging work assignments, training and educational programs. We hire, train, develop, and educate a workforce that is competent in performing job expectations by providing orientation, job specific training, professional certifications, external training and various continuous learning opportunities.

		As Micron enters into a new era of growth, its presence in Singapore plays an important role in its worldwide operations and overall success.


	 



 


 WHY JOIN US?



		What we value in our team members echoes what our customers value most in our company. As Micron team members, here’s how we strive to grow this value in our everyday jobs:

		 

Be Innovative
		As one of the most prolific patent holders in the world, we continually rethink, recast, and advance our ideas—so we're constantly creating new possibilities for leading-edge technologies.

		 

Be Trusted
		Some of the world’s most trusted brands rely on us to help their products soar to new heights. We couldn’t build this kind of trust without the integrity of our team members coupled with their vast industry experience and technology expertise.

		 

Be Collaborative
		They say two heads are better than one—and we agree! Since first opening our doors in 1978, we’ve been dedicated to truly collaborating with our coworkers as well as our customers and partners to engineer technology that drives innovation forward.

		 

Be Driven
		We value determination and drive in our team members—and their follow-through has been inspiring. We’ve got 26,000+ lifetime patents, hundreds of industry-leading awards, and an incredibly bright future to show for it.

title: Finance Controller (FC) / Finance Manager (FM)
description:
MEMIONTEC provides One Stop Total Water Treatment solutions by employing leading edge technology. We seek for enthusiastic and dedicated candidates to join us in our current aggressive expansion growth into global and regional market.
 
Financial Controller (FC) / Finance Manager (FM)
Job Location: Singapore
 
The Financial Controller (FC) / Finance Manger (FM) provides corporate and operational support to the Board of Directors (BOD) on all strategic and tactical matters relating to Project Financial forecast for (BOT) budget & management, cost benefit analysis, forecasting needs and the securing of new funding, in addition to the management and taking charge of the Finance Unit.
Responsibilities: 

Assist in performing all tasks necessary to achieve the organization’s mission and help execute staff succession and growth plans, including overall management of the Finance Unit.
To participate in developing new business and assist BOD in identifying new funding opportunities, the drafting of prospective budgets, and determining cost effectiveness of prospective businesses.
To participate in contract reviews, investment appraisals and forecast analysis.
Assess the benefits of all prospective contracts and advise the execution and implementation matters, ensure that all government regulations and requirements are in compliance.
Responsible for the complete financial and accounting functions including the review, formulation, implementation of corporate policies compliance, financial planning & analysis, taxation, management accounting, annual budgeting & forecasting, cost control, cashflow management, banking facilities, corporate secretarial and legal matters.
Understanding and have experiences on BOO, TOT, BOT Project financial forecast on Water & Waste Water industries.
Advise on the current and projected company financial position and to ensure compliance with SGX Rules & Regulations, IFRS, financial legislation, policies and procedures.
Maintain effective internal controls, supervise software implementation, company policies and procedures, corporate governance measures and operational reporting.
Liaise with auditors, tax consultants, bankers, lawyers and government agencies.
Liaise with Accountants of overseas subsidiaries to ensure timely and accurate submission of management and financial information of overseas subsidiaries and preparation of group consolidation.
Participate and drive ad-hoc projects and other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

BS in Accounting or Finance, MBA desirably with CPA.
Minimum 4 years (Finance Manager) / Minimum 8 years (Financial Controller) in progressively responsible financial leadership roles and work experience.
Influence and communicate complex topics to a broad and diverse stakeholder group.
Mature with high level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results orientation.
Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgement and make decisions based on accurate and timely analysis.
Strong interpersonal, communications and presentation skills.
Ability to build strong working relationships with management and employees across different cultures.
Ability to work under pressure and meeting deadlines.
Able to travel from time to time when needed.

 
 
An attractive remuneration package, benefits and challenging working environment and excellent career growth in the company would be offered to the successful candidate.

	Interested applicants, please apply directly to the email below, with a detailed resume, stating present and expected salary, date of availability and/or notice period required.

 JOB DESCRIPTION
   Senior Financial Analyst for Global US Pharma Company.  Your new company This World Leading Pharmaceutical and Medical Device Company is one of the Globes most successful businesses within the industry. They're offering a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst to join their Singapore office.  Your new role You will be responsible for supporting the overall forecasting, planning and analysis activities by business partnering with designated stakeholders. Duties will include business plan support and analysis, data analysis and trend and forecast reporting, quarter close and standard reporting, as well as establishing budget baselines by performing statistical trend analysis. In addition, you will be expected to lead in team meetings providing updates to senior management, as well as support the training of new team members.  What you'll need to succeed The successful candidate will be Degree qualified with a minimum of 4 years of working experience as a Financial Analyst within an MNC environment. You must have strong general accounting knowledge, have excellent communication skills to interact with Senior Management, as well as being able to think independently and strategically. You must adopt a hard-working, mature and intelligent mindset, being able to think and work commercially.  What you'll get in return This Company will offer you industry leading training, the ability to rotate and progress internally, as well as an attractive remuneration package and excellent company benefits.  What you need to do now If this sounds like an opportunity you are interested in, please email a word document of your CV to Samantha at samantha.kelly@hays.com.sg or apply online. title: Finance Director
description:
The Finance Director will drive the financial planning and management for the Group across all jurisdictions that the Group operates in. Reporting to the Executive Director and Group Managing Director, the Finance Director will drive the creation of stakeholder value through proactive business partnering, providing timely advice on working capital and financial management. Job ResponsibilitiesTeam developmentContinuous review of the operating efficacy of the Group's Finance team set-ups across various countries and implement improvements as appropriate.Developing and articulating a shared team vision, mission and values to the Finance team and assisting members to understand and embrace them.Motivate and coach team members, providing support as needed for them to grow in their roles.Develop an annual training plan for team members' professional development to enhance their skills-set and market value.Adopt rigour in the hiring process and strive to enhance retention.Plan for contingencies and succession.Financial Planning and Reporting Plan, execute and drive the annual budgeting process for the Group, including mid-year revisions.Conduct annual review and renewal of insurance coverage for the Group.Support and participate in financial scenario planning or strategic planning exercises from time to time.Track and provide analyses of financial performance against the budget and providing useful recommendations to management.Conduct both internal and external periodic peer financial reviews to develop key performance matrices and benchmarks.Ensure compliance with all internal reporting and statutory filing deadlines.Review, adopt and report on IFRS changes that will impact the results of the Group.Plan and manage the statutory audit process to ensure timely filing of results with ACRA.Contribute to the publication of the Group's Annual Report.Corporate Secretarial FunctionCoordinate with the Company Secretarial Agent to ensure compliance with all filing requirements under the Singapore Companies' Act.Coordinate the conduct of all Shareholders' meetings, Board of Directors' meetings, Sub-Committees' meetings, including the recording and circulation of Minutes.Assist the Group Managing Director to track matters arising from the meetings.Adapting and developing a code of Corporate Governance and Whistle-blowing policy applicable to the Group.Corporate Income Tax/ Goods & Services Tax/ Stamp Duties/ Business TaxReview and report on implications of annual budget pronouncements by the Minister of Finance and National Day Rally announcements to ensure management is kept abreast of changes.Perform annual tax planning studies for the Group to minimise tax burdens and ensure timely utilisation of capital allowances and tax losses.Assist the Tax Agent in the preparation of annual income tax returns and review to ensure compliance with relevant regulations.Ensure compliance with the Stamp Duties Act and Goods and Services Act.Treasury and Working Capital Manage the monthly operating cash flow projection and execute the required treasury activities to ensure adequacy of working capital in all operating units.Monitor monthly gearing and utilisation of bank facilities.Conduct annual review of banking facilities and the covenants' checklist to ensure adequacy and compliance.Work with external government agencies like SPRING, IE Singapore, EDB, IDA, ECDA, MOE, MSF etc to tap on available government funding or tax breaks.Financial Policy and Procedures Review existing internal Finance policies and procedures including delegation of authority matrices, banking approval matrices to identify gaps and recommend refinements with the aim of enhancing controls and at the same time improving efficiency.Supplement the Group's collection of policies and procedures with new ones every other month. Devise standardised templates for forms, reports where possible.Plan and execute annual inventory and capital assets count across the Group.Review existing workflow and procedures to ensure timely collection of receivables and on-time payment of payables.Support of Business Development Perform financial projections to assess financial feasibility of new projects that the Group intends to embark on.Develop operating budgets/ financial plans for new projects secured added during the year.Job Requirements Bachelors' degree in Accounting/ Finance or other equivalent academic qualifications.At least 8 years' experience in managing Finance teams of no less than 8 members.Strong integrity and good understanding of ethics.Hands-on, neat and meticulous to a fault and a strong propensity to be in control of facts/ numbers.Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and comfortable auditing and working with complex financial models.Working knowledge of Singapore-China cross-border tax issues (transfer pricing, withholding tax implications, Singapore-China Double Tax Agreement, profit repatriation from China to Singapore etc).Strong communicator with the ability to relate to people of a diverse mix of seniority and cultural background.Experience working with companies in China.Experience with new system implementation.Working knowledge of SGX listing and filing requirements

 COMPANY OVERVIEW


	Rolls-Royce, a world-leading provider of power systems and services for use on land, at sea and in the air, has established a strong position in global markets - civil aerospace, defence aerospace, marine and energy. As a result of this strategy, Rolls-Royce today has a broad customer base comprising more than 600 airlines, 4,000 corporate and utility aircraft and helicopter operators, 160 armed forces, more than 2,000 marine customers, including 70 navies, and energy customers in nearly 120 countries, with an installed base of 54,000 gas turbines.

	Rolls-Royce employs 39,000 skilled people in offices, manufacturing and service facilities in 50 countries. The Group has a strong commitment to apprentice and graduate recruitment, and to further developing employee skills. In 2009, Rolls-Royce invested £864 million on research and development, two thirds of which had the objective of further improving the environmental aspects of its products, in particular the reduction of emissions. Annual underlying revenues were £10.1 billion in 2009, of which about half came from services revenues. The firm and announced order book stood at £58.4 billion at 30 June 2010, providing visibility of future levels of activity.



 


 WHY JOIN US?


	There are many reasons to choose a Rolls-Royce career. The fact that we’re a global organisation active in 50 countries, and that we’ve spent the past 100 years building a reputation for technical innovation and excellence, are chief among them. Perhaps of even greater interest, however, is the fact that we expect to double in size over the next decade.

	Thanks to the dedication of our people, our global order book currently stands at £62.2 billion. To complete these orders to the exacting standards our customers expect, we need to grow. This means a wealth of opportunities for anyone who joins us. It means the chance to work with some of the world’s finest professional minds, to contribute to the future of responsible, low-impact power systems, to develop your skills and expertise to the highest levels, to gain international exposure with a company known for excellence, reliability and integrity.

	Rolls-Royce has enabled land-speed records, designed the world’s most environmentally friendly ships, and developed turbines that generate power in some of the most inhospitable places on earth. Over the past century, on land, at sea and in the air, we’ve continuously redefined what is possible.

	Join Rolls-Royce now, and you could do the same.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Who We Are
Global trade association in Singapore seeks an Executive Assistant/Executive Manager (EA/EM) to support our growing activities.

Position Available
Executive Assistant or Executive Manager (EA/EM) - depending on qualifications and experience

Role
To support the association’s senior management on all aspects of office support, external stakeholder relations, statutory obligations, and financial compliance.
 
Responsibilities


Help organize global Board of Directors and industry committee meetings.



Assist in sourcing, negotiating contracts, and working with office-related vendors (e.g., printers, translators, IT suppliers, etc.)


Overall office management, including ordering supplies, paying vendors, supervising cleaning staff.


Help senior management with global business trip logistics (e.g., flight/hotels, collaterals).  Assist with organization of association’s conferences and participation in exhibitions/trade shows.


Prepare monthly and annual filings to CPF, IRAS, ROS, Statistics Department and other relevant Singapore authorities.


Support senior management on all aspects of basic bookkeeping and accounts management, including working directly with audit, accounting, and corporate secretarial partners and service providers in Singapore and other global offices.


Maintain and keep organized all office hard-copy and computer filing systems.


Assist with membership outreach and support activities, including processing member requests and annual dues invoicing.

 
Qualifications:

Ability to work independently and good follow-up; mature and positive working attitude; ability to communicate with international and local business executives and government officials at all levels.


Critical skills:  attention to detail, accuracy, showing initiative, out-of-the-box thinking, team player


Work experience in an international organization or MNC environment preferred.  China-related experience a plus.


Experience liaising directly with senior government officials and C-level executives.
Computer literate in MS Office suite (particularly PPT and Excel) and Internet applications, database experience. 


Basic bookkeeping and/or financial-related experience desirable.


Excellent English communication skills required.  Additional Asian and/or Middle Eastern languages and dialects a plus (i.e., helpful for liaising with our global, multilingual stakeholders).


Candidates with at least 5-7 years work experience in an administrative support role.


Compensation will be commensurate with experience.

 
Please send your cover letter and resume – including current & expected compensation -- to us by July 7, 2017.  Interviews will take place on an on-going basis as qualified candidates are identified and shortlisted.  Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.


 
  








 COMPANY OVERVIEW

title: Senior Finance Manager
description:
Unique Hybrid Role, Treasury & Accounts Manager  Your new company This International Medical Devices Company is offering a fantastic opportunity for a Finance Manager to join their Singapore office.   Your new role This is a new role reporting to the VP Finance, and you'll be expected oversee all the finance and accounting activities, as well as the group treasury and risk management functions.  You will act as a key business partner by working closely with the executive team to deliver the treasury and risk management strategy to the group. You will be responsible for setting up the treasury function for the Group, implementing a treasury strategy, manage corporate banking relationships, and ensure a stable cash flow management, forecasting and treasury policies and procedures are optimised at Group level. Experience in managing cash flow, working capital, taxes, transfer pricing, risk management and insurances, budget, and general accounting are required.  You will also be responsible for ensuring all finances are properly administrated and monitored, to produce timely and accurate financial and management reports, prepare budget and forecast reports, and liaise with external parties such as auditors and tax.  What you'll need to succeed The successful candidate will be Degree qualified in Accountancy or Finance, as well as possessing a minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience in the full spectrum of accounts and treasury. Treasury experience is a must, as is good experience in risk management. You must be proficient in analysing financial data and prepare financial reports, statements and projections. You must be hands-on, have strong leadership and analytical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You need to be proactive and committed.  What you need to do now If this sounds like an opportunity you are interested in, please email a word document of your CV to Samantha at samantha.kelly@hays.com.sg or apply online. title: Accountant
description:
Position summary statement:
This position is responsible for the maintenance of the general ledger for all bank and cash accounts, prepare monthly bank reconciliation and assist in the reconciliation of all general ledger accounts. This position is also responsible for the maintenance of the fixed asset register and assist in the preparation of financial reports.
 
Primary Responsibilities:

To perform daily cash clearing to match the daily banking against cash collection reported from revenue postings.
To ensure that money inflow/outflow are accounted for in the form of accurate and timely submission of Bank Reconciliation reports.
To coordinate with Hotel Operations on direct deposits received in bank account and status of cheque clearance.
To monitor cash flow of the hotel and coordinate with Corporate Finance Treasury on funds transfer.
To maintain all records of Fixed Assets movement within the Hotel in a proper register that is always reconciled with the General Ledger.
To process all Capital Expenditure (capex) requisitions and ensure that required documentations are in order. To facilitate the approval process and maintain the status tracking for the submitted capex requisitions.
To control the fixed assets of the hotel covering for their acquisitions and disposals. To ensure timeliness of capitalisation of fixed assets and the review depreciation.
To ascertain the existence and presence of assets by conducting sighting/ audit of major category of assets in accordance with Corporate Policy.
To ensure monthly balance sheet schedules are accurately prepared and submitted timely.
To prepare the hotel financial and management reports as required by Corporate Office and hotel management.
To closely work with the Director of Finance and prepare the hotel’s annual budget. 
To prepare yearly Audit Schedules and government statistical reports.
To monitor contract expiry and liaise with various departments on renewals.
To supervise Hotel’s Operating Assets, which must tie with physical year end count and reconciliation.
To assist the Director of Finance in providing a high level of accounting services to internal customers, ensuring that the work of the staff members are performed as efficiently and effectively as possible within a given time frame. 
To relieve or extend any assistance to other accounts colleagues in their absence or whenever the need arises and to undertake any other related task / duty / assignment that may be given by the Director of Finance.
To undertake any other related task/duty/assignment that may be given by the supervisor.


Requirements:


Minimum of 5 years relevant working experience in finance. 
Degree in Accountancy or other Business degree
Good working knowledge of Singapore accounting standards and strong financial modelling skills. Job-holder should be prepared to be hands-on, and be able to deliver presentations to senior management
Independent, resourceful, hands-on and the ability to think ‘outside the box’
Evidence of strong interpersonal skills. with the ability to shape others views, inspire and coordinate others
Able to commence work immediately or in short notice is an advantage

We apologise that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

 COMPANY OVERVIEW

Founded in 2007 in Singapore, Capita Pte Ltd is a premium recruitment expert and staffing provider for international companies in Singapore and across Asia. Encompassing local and international placements, contract and temporary staffing, outplacement as well as payroll services across all industry sectors, Capita’s highly personalised service ensures that its clients find the right talent to meet their human resource needs. Capita’s service offering is split into corporate and specialised divisions. While the corporate division comprises the business support and outsourcing practices that focus on permanent, contract and temporary positions, the specialised division has a focus on the engineering, banking and finance as well as technology industries. With more companies requiring candidates for specialist functions as well as talent with generalist capabilities in an increasingly competitive business environment, these divisions ensure that clients work with industry-focused consultants with specific expertise to match their talent management needs.In 2012, Capita expanded its footprint in Asia, opening an office in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to better serve regional clients. Capita  has been recognised as one of the preferred HR Vendors of the Year for six consecutive years since 2010. title: NPI -Process Engineer (Molding)
description:
(A) Primary Function
1) Smooth operations of all engineering related activities of the product line concerned
2) Improve quality and drive production yield
3) New RFQ enquiry and provide cycle time study on new product
4) Perform product and process validation

(B) Duties and Responsibilities
1) Establish optimum process parameters and meeting specific cycle time for new product.
2) Analyze defect reported in-house and customer with quality, tooling and production
3) Testing and qualification of all new molds by applying systematic molding that includes Load Sensitivity Test, Viscosity/Shear Rate Test, Gate Freeze Test, Thermal Mapping of Mold, Short Short Test etc
4) Perform DOE on molding process parameter for process window study
5) Attend to all daily quality and process related issues
6) Prepare and execute process validation protocols and reports for new and existing products with tooling and quality personnel for all customers
7) Participate in the Continuous Process Improvement programme to improve productivity, reduce scrap
8) Perform internal quality system audit.
9) Execute engineering change notice from customer/ in house and update ERP system promptly
10) Compliance to all regulatory and in house system requirements especially for medical and automotive customers

(C) Qualifications / Requirements
1) Degree/Diploma in Engineering-related discipline, preferably in Polymer and Plastic technology, Mechanical
2) At least 3 years experience in Plastic Injection Molding, preferably in medical and automotive industries
3) Knowledge in ISO9001, ISO13485, TS16949, familiar with FMEA, PPAP, APQP and IOPQ
4) Possess strong leadership, positive attitude, analytical and good interpersonal skills

 COMPANY PHOTOS

























 


 COMPANY OVERVIEW



Founded in 1981, Beyonics Technology Limited is a leading provider of advance contract manufacturing services to original equipment manufacturers ("OEMs") in computer storage devices, medical devices and electronics communication products and a leading manufacturer of precision machining parts for the hard disk drive, electronics and automotive industry.
The contract manufacturing services include printed circuit board assembly, full turnkey system assembly, testing, packing and distribution, manufacturing of plastics injection mould parts and precision stamping parts. The precision machining services include the design and fabrication of tools, die casting and precision machining.
Beyonics Technology Limited aims to grow strategic manufacturing partnerships with its portfolio of world-class, leading-edge customers. This will be achieved through its supply chain leadership, vertically integrated operations, strong customer focus as well as the synergies of its dedicated and motivated management team.


 
Product & Services


Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) Our Capabilities
Through its extensive capabilities and facilities throughout the Asia Pacific region, Beyonics is able to offer a wide range of EMS solutions to customers looking to outsource their manufacturing operations.
Our EMS Solutions include:
Design and Engineering Services
Prototyping
PCBA facilities such as Surface Mount Technology (SMT), Plated Through Hole (PTH) and mixed technology BGA, CSP and Flip Chip Assembly
Clean and No-clean processes for PCBA
In-Circuit & Functional Tests / Burn-in Tests Full system test
Class 100 & 1000 clean rooms
Dedicated mechanical assembly team
Full Box Build capability to handle turnkey projects all the way from component and material sourcing to logistical distribution
Vertically integrated manufacturing support from Beyonics Complementary Business Divisions -Design Engineering, Plastics moulding, metal stamping, die-casting, precision machining Repair services
Our Facilities We have 3 fully integrated EMS campuses; two of which are located in Kulai and Tampoi, Malaysia and one in Suzhou, China. In addition we have 6 EMS plants located in Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia. In total, we have more than 100 SMT lines servicing our customers.


 



 


 WHY JOIN US?

Our Mission is to provide world-class manufacturing, delivering high quality products and services to our customers through a dedicated team of people with excellent continuous improvement programme.
 
Our Vision is to be our customers' global choice of partner through vertically integrated manufacturing.

 About This Company 

SEACARE MANPOWER SERVICES PTE LTD 





Seacare Manpower Services Pte Ltd is one of the biggest and most reputable suppliers of manpower in Singapore.
 
Incorporated since 13th October 1995, it started as a human resource agency for placement workers for both maritime and non-maritime personnel.
 
Our pool of manpower ranges from professionals such as AV/IT technician, ICT Executive, Teacher's Aide, Certification Officer, and Membership Service Recruiters, to general workers such as Office Admin, Receptionist, Operations Support Officer, and Event Helpers among others.

title: Financial Accountant (Regional)
description:
With a LSE listed MNC in the business services industryClient DetailsOur client is a globally well-known market leader in the recruitment field with offices in over 35 countries. They have been growing their APAC business presence significantly for the past few years and have made Singapore their APAC headquarter. Due to the growth plans and the continuous need for process improvement, they are now recruiting for a Financial Accountant (Regional) for their team.Description 
Reporting to the Finance Controller, you will be managing the books Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia for the financial and management reporting. Your team of 2 people will be supporting these countries on taxation, audit as well as financial accounting. The business is going through extensive projects to drive the efficiency and the processes in the APAC region. This is a unique role that will allow you significant growth and exposure to the senior management.Profile 
To apply, you should have:

Degree in accountancy/ACCA
At least 3 years of experience in financial accounting in Singapore and Malaysia market
Supervisory experience is highly preferred
Be independent with a proactive mindset
Available to start work on a short notice
Job OfferThis opportunity allows for you to take on a high visibility role acting as a 2nd in charge to the Financial Controller and handling 3 countries within this region. The role is the chance for you to step up into a senior role and take on the next step in your career.To apply online please click the Apply button below.
